Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Hotel in Chicago-A Grand Tribute to Time”
Reviews.Author: tbfairfield
Reviews.Content: The Drake is one of if not my personal favorite hotel in Chicago. This Grand old hotel simply has a wonderful location in the city. The Lobby is a reminder of the elegance which has been lost in modern hotels-it's beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: DraperyDude
Reviews.Content: Everything about this property is excellent. The staff at the front (bellmen and front desk) are very attentive and helpful. Property is located very conviniently between Michigan Avenue and Lake Shore. The hotel sits far enough off both roads so it seems a little more quiet. The decor is nice as the property balances their history and elegance of their property but not making the guestrooms to over the top and traditional. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning”
Reviews.Author: Oliver B
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Drake for a week long business trip. What an inredible property. The room (Executive King Lakeview Suite) was beautiful, the staff were attentive and professional. All in all, a first class experience. I'll never stay anywhere else in Chicago. By the way, try the Clam Chowder at Coq 'd Or. Best Ive ever had!

Reviews.Title: “A True Gem”
Reviews.Author: cbd17
Reviews.Content: The Drake hotel is a wonderful experience with a warm and caring staff, gorgeous decor and a great lcoation.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding stay!”
Reviews.Author: Scott D
Reviews.Content: I recently had a one night stay at this hotel while I was in town for a job interview. The staff could not have been more accomodating, friendly or professional. From the moment I checked in (with no preferred status) and Tiffany at the desk offered me an upgraded room with a lake view at no extra charge I was overly impressed. As I was on my way out the door to my interview, my front suit jacket button popped off. I quickly walked over to Mary Carmen at the concierge desk and asked if she had any string to fix it (not wanting to push my luck and ask her to fix it). She immediately offered to sew it back on (which I was more than happy to allow) and had it good as new in seconds. Definitely a life saver before such an important meeting. To relax after a long day, I stopped in the bar and was again, blown away by the hospitality and service provided by Polo, the bartender. I will definitely be back and wish to extend my thanks to the entire staff for such an enjoyable experience!

Reviews.Title: “Old traditional style hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aht_11
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a trip to Chicago staying at the Drake Hotel. The hotel was lovely, traditional elegance with a grand lobby. The staff were excellent, friendly and helpful. The hotel was located just at the top of the Magnificent Mile, in a good location but next time I would prefer something right in the centre. Nevertheless, the shops, restaurants were all in walking distance. The rooms were a nice size, not very big but I think they were outdated and could do with modernising. The lobby and outside areas were very clean, but my room itself wasn't. The light switch and bath were dirty as were the bedding. Also, lack of amenities compared to other hotels. I was a bit disappointed with the no wifi access in rooms that I had to pay for. Most hotels offer free wifi now. I had breakfast at the hotel one morning the service and selection was great for the a la carte but very pricey. It was cheaper to eat outside. I would suggest paying extra for a room with a view.

Reviews.Title: “Fit for royalty”
Reviews.Author: dkjames
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 4 days in Chicago staying at the Drake Hotel. We found excellent prices on Hotels.com $122/night and decided to live in style. It's a beautiful hotel in the grand old style with impeccable service and spacious rooms. Everything was spotless. We ate breakfast there every morning and the quality and choice, either menu or buffet , were tops. The wait-staff couldn't do enough to make you comfortable. We also had a lunch in the bar - the best lobster rolls ever! (And we've eaten them many times in Bar Harbor, Maine.) The location was perfect - right at the top of the Magnificent Mile with many bus lines right outside or beautiful walks down Michigan Ave. It was our first visit to this truly gorgeous city and we're planning to return soon as there is so much more to see.

Reviews.Title: “like going back in time.”
Reviews.Author: rtbasic
Reviews.Content: was exactly as I remembered it from several years earlier. simply a timeless classic in one of my favorite cities in the US. the place oozes charm.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - Twin Room”
Reviews.Author: Mamie66
Reviews.Content: Met a girlfriend in the middle of the country and we chose The Drake as our hotel. The twin-bed room was perfect for the two of us -- 9th floor (no view). The room and hotel was clean and the carpets felt fresh. There was a little wear on the edges but for the most part we felt the room was just right and we got a good value for what we paid (we did get the government rate). We enjoyed a late dinner in the downstairs bar/restaurant and high tea on Saturday (make reservations for tea!). The hotel was perfectly situated for shopping -- which is all we did. The staff was friendly and helpful. We would stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “weekend meeting in chicago”
Reviews.Author: Josie053
Reviews.Content: had a very pleasant stay at The Drake this past weekend.Room was large and well appointed with good amenities.Unbeilavable location just off the best area of Michigan Avenue so best shopping and great restaurants. Best person there - Carlos - the doorman - first class and really knew how to get us around lounge enterttainment on Fri/Sat night super

Reviews.Title: “Rude Treatment”
Reviews.Author: ArkansasBoilermaker
Reviews.Content: The folks who answer the phone at this hotel are unbelievably rude--I could not believe how my phone calls were handled. All I needed to know was how to get from the airport to the hotel on the metro/train, and the first time I was forwarded to the concierge to answer that question (and all I got was an answering machine) and the second time I called, I was hung up on after I asked about the metro stop! Oh my goodness, the individuals I talked to were just plain unprofessional.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Hotel on the Magnificent Mile”
Reviews.Author: RichardMadow
Reviews.Content: The Drake has fantastic old world charm but manages to still feel hip and relevant. As soon as you enter the lobby you know that you are in a true classic. The decor is beautiful and the staff very gracious and friendly. The rooms may not have all the electronic amenities of a super modern hotel, but the classic charm and feel more than make up for it. The location at the top of The Magnificent Mile is absolutely perfect - you can walk to everything but it is just slightly removed from all the hubbub. Also, the service is outstanding. My sink was slightly clogged - I called guest services and when I returned about an hour later not only was it fixed but they left a little note telling me so. Nice touch! Breakfast at The Drake Brothers was good; I would suggest ordering off the menu as opposed to the buffet. Also - Hilton Honors members get fantastic upgrades here - or at least I did. The Executive Suite with a lake view is amazing!!!

Reviews.Title: “Chicagoan's stay at The Drake”
Reviews.Author: TravelCHI_08
Reviews.Content: As a Chicagoan, I pass The Drake each day and have always wanted to stay there. Over the weekend, I did just that. We were able to reserve a room for a moderate price and enjoyed a night out on the town. As other reviewers stated, The Drake is magnificent with historic charm. The hotel's accommodations were excellent. The staff was friendly and very helpful. I did not experience any of the issues mentioned by other reviewers in regards to thin walls, maintenance issues, or the like. Our experience was top notch. I will certainly mention this property to out of town guests!

Reviews.Title: “Great w/e spot”
Reviews.Author: CJCMan
Reviews.Content: As we were attending a dinner dance at the hotel, we decided to bite the bullet and spend the w/e, even though we live less than 30 miles away. The hotel has a definite charm and personality. We didn't splurge on a fancy room overlooking lakeshore but the room was nice. Not the size, you'll get in Vegas, but, hey, this is Chicago. The meal for the dinner dance was probably THE best we have had at an event like this. It is really difficult to cook filet nicely for 300+ people, but these guys do it. We went crazy the following day and had "Afternoon Tea." It isn't cheap, but as a once every so often treat, it is really enjoyable and to my surprise quite filling. There is a reason why so many good hotels are in this part of the city. The location is fabulous. Being able to walk on the lake shore at this time of year was a joy and made us feel as if we were a thousand miles from home. I hear the kids calling! Back to reality! For a w/e away, the hotel, food and location take beating.

Reviews.Title: “Don't pay full price”
Reviews.Author: FrankSUSA
Reviews.Content: One of the primo hotels in Chicago $$$$, but if you do priceline, bid even lower than we did @ $79 a night, you might get it. And if you check what it costs regulary to stay there, you'd better be sitting down. It's close to EVERYTHING, meaning that you can walk wherever. So, who pays retail anymore, even for a luxury hotel!?

Reviews.Title: “Classic Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cavertoo
Reviews.Content: The Drake in Chicago is in a great location, very clean, and only a short walk to many fine restaurants and shopping. The hotel is classic and beautiful, with large rooms. The staff is friendly and accommodating. The only con is the lack of wireless access in the rooms and having to pay $12.95 for 24 hours of wired access. The last several hotels I stayed in NYC offered free wireless access in the rooms. Overall our trip was a pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great views with character at the Grande Dame of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: TinleyKing
Reviews.Content: This grand old hotel is in the perfect Water Tower Michigan Ave location with spectacular views of the Gold Coast, Lake Michigan and Oak Street Beach. The Drake takes you back to the opulence of the 1920s. We had a lot of fun watching what we assumed to be octagenerian neighborhood regulars dancing to a live jazz band in the Palm Court. Like the Drake they were old and a little worn but they still got it baby. I hear the rooms can be hit or miss. Ours was great - a 6th floor Jr. King Suite. It was very spacious with the best views. It was a little drafty, a little noisy and a little tired but that was easy to overlook given the location, charm, spacious room and the price. The old girl's been around the block a few times but still worth asking to the dance.

Reviews.Title: “You will not be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoOlivia
Reviews.Content: I chose a king room for 2 adults, in the most inexpensive class, street vs/ lakeside. Although I sincerely wanted the lakeside (as did everyone else), The interior room was quite adequate. No, it was beautiful! From the carpeting to the pull-down blinds, to the bed, pillows and view. We were very familiar with the Drake and always wondered what it would be to stay here. I can tell you that: beginning with the street-side valet (which was included in the room price along with as many in & outs free), the relaxing breakfast lakeside breakfast whose staff were attentive to your every need, to the multiple restaurants, ambiance, and luxury thorough-out (and much more), THIS IS CHICAGO'S FINEST!!! I mean it, my stay was wonderful. I sat in the club chair looking out upon the streets of Chicago and just relaxed. The bathroom had a new bathtub (I took my first bath that night, the first in years), a rather odd arrangement for the toilet with the paper on the wall behind you. There is an individual cup coffee maker in the room. The bed seemed to be larger that a king, and it was a first, my husband didn't snore that night. BTW, The room is QUIET! I heard nothing from other rooms, doors, hallway noise or wheeling carts. Nothing. I was extremely happy. We will stay here again when we are looking for a place to stay in the city. This hotel exuded classy elegance vs. the Trump I stayed at who had a very large and metal feeling to it. I wish I had not bothered reading others reviews. I was told what a long walk it was in the hotel to your room. Mine sure wasn't. This was an extremely unusual February, it is 40-50 deg, it is windy, of course, but not cold at all to us who live in Illinois or Cchicago. The only thing I can think of would be a night turn-down with chocolates on your pillow. Now wouldn't that be nice?

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: haparev
Reviews.Content: The Drake, I can't get enough of you! Pros: -Historic, nicely remodeled building -Unionized staff -Streeterville/Magnificent Mile location -Got a great conference rate for rooms -Really nice conference/banquet space -Nice soap/shampoo in the rooms -Nice coffee makers in rooms Cons: -Internet in rooms is wired only (and costs $12.95 for 24 hours) -$6 charge for room service (instead of the usual $2.50) I would definitely stay here again. It is a lovely place, with friendly and helpful staff. There is a cafe on the lower level for low-key simple breakfast, plus their full restaurant breakfast. I didn't try their fancy night bar, but it looked nice.

Reviews.Title: “NYE”
Reviews.Author: WiseAdventurer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days over NYE. Location: Michigan Ave. / Magnificent Mile -- AMAZING...close to everything. Hit the bloomingdales - amazing deals! AND if your from out of state: you get 15% off on top of that (go to customer service to ask for the coupon). We took the L train all over the city and it was just awesome- buy the 7 day pass and explore! Make sure to head to Wicker park area...soooo cool! Go to Wormhole Cafe for coffee....sooooooo goood. Rooms: As Hilton hons member, I was given an upgrade to a king suite. Lovely room with old world charm. Strange about no wifi in rooms....I was annoyed at first, BUT you know, its a good thing, cause its time to escape and not be on your devices...for business i guess not great, but hey, for vacation I say great...we need to interact and be together! There is free wifi in lobby. Super Comfy beds. Rates: We booked our deal including flight ....Amazing since it was over NYE. We could hear our neighbors (young people partying for NYE talking about how they paid 400 to stay the night). So, we definitely got an amazing deal. Sometimes thin walls are a good thing. ;) Made my day as I love a deal! ;) Elite Breakfast: It was pretty so so. The wait staff don't seem to clear the tables, so we did so ourselves each morning so that we got a seat. It was pretty weak. No eggs, just cold things like yog, cereal, bread, muselix, fruits, salmon, etc. They often ran out of stuff if you get there 1/2 before closing. Also, one of the mornings they started putting the food away before it was over which was a little rude. Lobby: Beautiful. Wish we tried the various restos due to the history but we didn't so I can't comment. Next time hopefully. We tried to get a drink the one night but it was an hour wait and the waiter was a little stuffy for my liking so we didn't bother. NYE: we were going to a concert at the Aragon ballroom, but the hotel was hosting a swanky party. Maybe hit that next year! Highly recommend this hotel. It is nice to stay in a place with history, old charm, etc. I also LOVE the carpets....you will see what i mean! And yes, the walls are thin and you can hear people if you are trying, but most times it was quiet and comfortable~

Reviews.Title: “Happy Holiday”
Reviews.Author: KenR4039
Reviews.Content: Staying at The Drake for Christmas has become a holiday tradition for my family. We spend dozens of nights at hotels and motels throughout the year but NOTHING compares with this property. As soon as you enter you know you have enter someplace special. See you next year!

Reviews.Title: “Classic Chicago hotel”
Reviews.Author: chostetler
Reviews.Content: The Drake is a fantastic hotel to stay at while in Chicago. Not only is it within walking distance to amazing shopping, but you are right in front of lake Michigan. The lobby is beautiful, and the rooms are nice. (we had a corner room and it was the largest room I have ever stayed in.....huge!!) this is a 'classic', historical hotel don't expect modern, retro rooms. The hotel is worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Historic Hotel, But....”
Reviews.Author: ToBHonest
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Drake for a week in January on business. I had heard much about the historic significance of the hotel and it did not disappoint! The lobby is beautiful, with a nice, old-world style charm and the display of famous guests on the ground floor shows the caliber of quality the hotel is hoping to convey. Check-in was easy and the location was great; near shopping, restaurants and attractions. Despite these factors, there were several things that made my stay difficult. To begin, there is no wi-fi available in-room, which is somewhat surprising in 2012! Along these lines, the TV featured only analog channels. Again, it's 2012! I'm not sure why such details, which are standard in much lower-grade hotels, are left out here. Additionally, the walls are very thin. I was kept up on several nights by noisy neighbors, whose conversations I could hear word for word. Also, the heater runs rather loud, which may disturb those who are light sleepers. Finally, despite the beautiful historic charm of the lobby and public spaces in the hotel, the rooms themselves just appear more old and worn-out than historic. The furniture is chipped, the bathrooms appear to have been half-heartedly renovated and I even found stains on my sheets. Overall, I was disappointed and will likely stay elsewhere for future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: TripReporter177
Reviews.Content: The Drake Hotel is a great hotel located right off Michigan avenue in the center of Chicago. Also the lake is not even 100 meters away from the hotel, so the location is great. Rooms are spacious and have a separate room for clothes and suitcases, mattresses very comfy, and bathrooms absolutely fine. The service is excellent as one expects if staying at a five star hotel. ALso the building is architecturally interesting. I would go there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Surprise”
Reviews.Author: NumberOneOmnivore
Reviews.Content: Old but filled with history and culture. Half of the staff seems to have been here for decades and they really know what they are doing. You have to check out the bar. And, btw, the rates are great.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago Favorite”
Reviews.Author: mke60
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at half a dozen nice hotels in downtown Chicago, and The Drake is my favorite. I enjoy staying in well maintained historical elegant hotels and The Drake does not disappoint on that account. The service is on par with the reputation and the location is excellent for Michigan Ave. / Magnificent Mile shopping, dining and entertainment. With any historic hotel, rooms can vary greatly from tiny to grand, so your experience may vary accordingly. It's worth booking at least one room category above the lowest price to set you up for a possible upgrade and keep you out of a closet (albeit an elegant closet) of a room. If you get lucky you may have a special experience. I booked a Drake Suite, and, upon request, was upgraded to a Gold Coast Suite with a large bedroom, separate parlor, marble bathroom with large Jacuzzi tub and separate shower, plus a killer view of Lake Michigan and Lakeshore Drive. If you are Hilton Honor's and get the breakfast benefit, that will be in the Drake Brothers Restaurant with menu availability against the credit, far preferable in my opinion than an executive floor lounge breakfast. Make it a point to have a drink in the Coq D Or' - claimed to have opened the day after Prohibition. Afternoon High Tea is another highlight in the Palm Court. If the rates for my dates are relatively reasonable, The Drake will remain my first choice when staying in Chicago. Parking Tip: Hotel valet parking is $55 / night. On the north side of Walton Place first driveway just west of Michigan Avenue, 1/2 block from the front door, park at the One Mignificent Mile garage for $29 / 24 hours (no in/out, cash only).

Reviews.Title: “"Magnificent" hotel on the Magnificent Mile.”
Reviews.Author: Grubbee
Reviews.Content: Ours was a trip for some much needed "child-free" time in order to celebrate our anniversary. I have been to Chicago many times and stayed at various hotels but this trip was special. I wanted, for my wife and I, a hotel that would not only allow us the rest and privacy we needed, but also a location that would afford us the opportunity to experience the "Windy City". The Drake was one of my top choices because of the reputation and history surrounding it. To begin, I discovered the parking price was average for that part of the city, but with the ease of the hotel's valet service, it was a no-brainer. Use the valet parking! You will save yourself time and keep your blood pressure normal. The lobby was truly beautiful with a sort of "old-world" charm and class that few places have been able to maintain. The front desk staff were helpful and friendly as expected. Our room was huge! It was appropriately furnished but some things appeared quite aged and in need of updates. The bed was quite comfortable and provided a good night's rest. The view, much to my chagrin, was nothing to speak of. Overall, the room was acceptable but not spectacular. The other areas of the hotel, however, were truly "magnificent."

Reviews.Title: “excellent grand old hotel”
Reviews.Author: remarkfarm
Reviews.Content: i have been staying their for 25 years and it is still great

Reviews.Title: “Elegance at it`s best!!”
Reviews.Author: meme w
Reviews.Content: We spent the weekend of December 9-12 at the Drake Hotel in Chicago. For years I`d heard how elegant & special The Drake was. It exceeded all expectations!! The large room was perfect, the conceierge couldn`t have been more helpful (recommending places, making reservations--in general making sure that our stay there was perfect. The pub grille (with a piano) was super--ate there twice---& the high tea was all & more than I`d been told. It is a perfect location--basically on the Miracle Mile & convenient for both walking & taxis. Can`t wait to spend time at The Drake again!!

Reviews.Title: “A may be a bit partial, but it remains great”
Reviews.Author: RickinShelby
Reviews.Content: Long ago I stayed here once all alone for 2 weeks for business, and i fell in love with the place. Periodically I returned for 3-4 days at a time, and I continued to love the place. That was then. On my most recent stay at The Drake, I confirmed that it is as terrific as EVER! That said, some things about it are old and need a bit of work, but as a whole it remains a gret place to stay on the north end of Michigan Avenue.

Reviews.Title: “a fine historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: CapitalMom
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Drake in January 2012. We pre-paid and got a very good rate. The neighbourhood is great. It is just off Michigan Ave and convenient for all the lovely stores on the Magnificent Mile and an easy walk to the conference I attended at large, chain hotel. We had a family room with 2 queen beds, 2 bathrooms, and a pleasant seating area. The first room we were given was 656 and it looked towards a brick. We could see right into the bathroom of an apartment in the neighboring building. We asked to move and went to room 621 which was much brighter and had a nice view of Michigan Avenue. The hotel was full but it never felt crowded or busy. Once in our room, we could not hear the street noise or sounds from other guests. It felt very private and secluded despite its central location. Check in was seamless. The lobby is a beautiful and spacious. The hallways are wide and very well lit with attractive wall paper and carpets. The staff are gracious and friendly. We enjoyed a drink one evening at the bar downstairs. It is pleasant and we enjoyed chatting with other guests at the bar. Overall, it was a nice stay. I would not, however, say this was a great hotel. It does not have the extras I have enjoyed at other hotels with a similar reputation. For example, there is no bathrobe in the closet, the towels are not plush, the heat system was at times loud and clanging, the air is so dry we all woke up in the middle of the night craving water and this could easily be fixed with the installation of a humidifier system, the turn down service offers salt water taffy which seems decidedly down market and odd in a place not known for salt water, and one evening the housekeeper who came in for turn down service left a bag of ice on the chair which we did not notice until morning and it left a big wet mess on the carpet. One small detail we did love was the small sofa in the elevator. It seemed so elegant to sit while the elevator carried us to our floor. If I compare the Drake to the Waldorf Astoria or the Shoreham in Washington DC, it does not come up to that level. It is lovely. It has excellent staff. It is spotless and the historic charm is so appealing. Perhaps my expectations were wrong but I was a bit disappointed. I did enjoy thinking I was at the same hotel enjoyed by Princess Diana, Bob Hope and Smokey Robinson. If you like historic hotels and charm, you will enjoy the Drake.

Reviews.Title: “Great New Year's Stay at the Drake!”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinsFinest
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Drake for a New Year's visit, and thoroughly enjoyed my stay. The service, decor, and location was second to none. I arrived early in the rain after a red eye flight into O'Hare at around 7am. Although I was weary, I did not expect the front desk to be able to check me in that early, they pleasantly surprised me by allowing me to do so. My room was small with a view of the fire escape, but was comfortable nonetheless, and I slept soundly. The bathroom and closet was quite spacious. The lobby was decorated for the holidays and the entire hotel was quite festive. The location cannot be beat, right on Michigan Avenue, within easy walking distance to shopping, restaurants, and night life. I utilized the spacious and well-equipped fitness center on two occasions, which has all the amenities of a regular health club. The concierge was most helpful in finding me a rent a car, just a block away, which I needed for the latter part of my trip. Overall, I hope to be back and recommend to all who are travelling to downtown Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Enchanted Christmas in the City”
Reviews.Author: Pgholson
Reviews.Content: We spent Christmas at the Drake this year and were absolutely delighted with our experience. There is magic in the air with the splendid tree and the bustling of activity over the holiday. Alot of tradition is still in play and the old world of Chicago gets celebrated here. Even the flower shop is a treat to walk through! The staff were gracious and jolly and made the experience of being away from home an enjoyable one. We splurged on a lakeview suite that was a perfect place to rest and enjoy the time there-plus it gave us space to entertain our family that live in Chicago and do some celebration where we were and not just at that places in the city. We also opted for the bed and breakfast package that came with the bufffet breakfast each day that was very worthwhile. We had Christmas Eve dinner with familiy in the Cape Cod Room and the waitstaff were funny and joined in our holiday antics.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel But....”
Reviews.Author: gdmuscle
Reviews.Content: On NewYears Eve 2011 upon our arrival we were greeted by Gentlemen who helped us with our luggage and opened the car door and ask if we need assistance. Checkin is smooth and our luggage and car is taken care of immediately by the very helpful staff. There wasn't an instance that you were never made feeling a special guest. Elevators are quick, lobby immaculate and rooms are very clean upon arrival. Although this is an older hotel there will be some minor cosmetic quirks in your room but they are very clean and well maintained. There is wifi in the Lobby but not in the rooms, the bell boy told us that they are installing Wifi in the rooms in 2012 so that is a plus. Our stay was very pleasant even on NewYears Eve where you would think noise would be an issue because of a 3000 guest party in one of the Banquet Halls. Just a word of warning, some rooms do have adjoining doors to other rooms which can be a very bad idea. We happen to end up with one of those rooms and it wasn't a very pleasant experience until we had called the front desk. In the adjacent room there were kids banging on the walls, creating a rucous and one was going in and out of their rooms slamming the door in the hallway. A quick call to the front desk helped the matter but you were made to wonder that the parents don't realize that it's a hotel not a playground. Conversation can be heard in these type of rooms so be very aware of this as we noticed on the other wall where a couple of people were staying. I'm sure they heard every word we also said but if privacy is what you need this isn't the type of room you would get, suggest you get one that don't have these doors. A good set of earplugs helped during the night but we regret that we didn't ask for a different room but the hotel was almost completely booked for that weekend. All in all our stay was great except these minor issues and the staff made us feel very comfortable, thanks to our great front desk manager for the complementary breakfast. We would love to suggest this Hotel to our friends and relatives.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for business”
Reviews.Author: Allen T
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. Centrally located. One of the most famous in chicago. Rooms are old but the hotel is well maintained and in great shape. Very comfortable rooms a bit warm at times. I was only there for one night and that was my only complaint, the rooms temprature was warm and i had no temp control.

Reviews.Title: “Drake-Time to update”
Reviews.Author: Thelaman
Reviews.Content: Always go to Chicago at Christmastime- lobby always looks wonderful. But the room I had, a juinor suite, looking out on Lake Shore Drive, and the snowy lake, is looking tired.Used to stay at Ambassador East, but left that for Drake, when it began looking worn out. Now its been reinvented as The Public, and looks great. Suggest Drake do the same.Don't lose the charm, but update, before you lose your luster.

Reviews.Title: “Our Mainstay in Chi-Town”
Reviews.Author: jdm3x
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have developed the excellent habit of staying at The Drake every year during the holidays when visiting her family in the Chicago area. The hotel is top notch in every aspect. The rooms are spacious and appropriately furnished. The beds are extremely comfortable and the hotel is perfectly situated in the Gold Coast near Water Tower Place and Michigan Ave but also near Lincoln Park. This past trip we took a walk up to and through Lincoln Park as the weather was unseasonably mild. This was the perfect way to spend a leisurely morning. While there we stopped in Basil Leaf Cafe and were treated to a limited yet brilliantly diverse selection of micro and international beers, some of the best bread and dipping oil and fantastic soup to warm back up. What an excellent find! While staying at The Drake we always make it a point to stop by Coq d'Or - our favorite watering hole in town.

Reviews.Title: “A class apart”
Reviews.Author: Ipsitha
Reviews.Content: One of the finest Hilton properties.. And a class apart. I have stayed in the Conrad In Michigan avenue, which is way different from this. I'm a HH member so I usually land in one of he Hilton hotels. I see a reason why most celebrities including princess diana stayed her, it's a culture rich hotel and maintained it's originality. The best time to stay here is during Christmas, cause the details in the way they have decorated the hotel and their Christmas tree ... Is something one should watch out for

Reviews.Title: “Great Anniversary Memories”
Reviews.Author: oshkoshtraveler61
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Drake to celebrate our 20th anniversary December 27 - 29. Having stayed for our honeymoon, and on many occasions since, there was no doubt about where to stay this year. A junior suite with executive floor privileges was the start of a great stay. The hotel is as beautiful as ever, with some recent renovations obvious. Our only disappointment was that the room was somewhat worn looking, and the bathroom very small for a suite. Also, lack of wi-fi in rooms was inconvenient. Otherwise, another great visit to a truly "Grand " Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed and Discombobulated”
Reviews.Author: gogirl51
Reviews.Content: We checked in on Dec 23rd as a stopover between Missouri and Wisconsin, where we were to spend Christmas. There certainly was some "good" interspersed with the "bad" and I make it my rule to always post the "good" first. So, the lobby of this grand dame is lovely with lots to see for all ages in many holiday decorations. Our rooms were ready at 3:10 when we arrived and we upgraded to the Club Floor but for $60 each but I really do love being on the Club whenever I can because of all that entails. And we were told that the rooms themselves were nicer too. And maybe they were. My mom's room was right next door to ours but it was nicer with a nice entryway with pretty console table, a loveseat and so forth. Ours was a bit odd in that it was just set up wrong such as the loveseat not facing the TV but positioned along the same wall as the TV - weird. The bathrooms are very plain - nothing fancy as in many hotels. We were told that the appetisers in the Club were not complimentary so we went down to the Coq d'Or and got 2 bowls of soup, a bowl of fries and several glasses of wine for $83 only to find out that the Club is in fact complimentary. We're not cheap but we figured if we have to pay for snacks in the Club, why not go down to the pub and have our choice of what to order. We didn't want a lot as we going out for a big dinner at 6:30 so the snacks would have held us over. The bed was comfortable and we slept well. In the morning, we had another problem. We thought the water controls on the tub were the ones you use to turn on the water and the dial above is a divertor to send it up to the shower but we couldn't get the water to stop coming out below so the tub was filling up faster than it could drain so you're standing in hot water as you're trying to shower. After this we had had it and felt a call to the front desk was in order explain some of this. They apologized for the miscommunication on the Club amenities. About the tub, she said, 'Yes - they have heard that from other guests and they knew the tub didn't work right. Well, that's all I needed to hear - if I was the first one to have this problem, I'd have thought maybe I was the dense one - but to have known that this was a problem for previous guests and not the have done something about it - ridiculous! They did comp us back the $60 upcharge per room but I would much rather have had a more successful experience. My hope when traveling is to have a really great experience all the way around and if I pay a little more for it - fine! But that is just not what happened. I think - no I know - I'll stay somewhere else next time in Chicago! P.S. The staff up in the Club were truly lovely and the view there was spectacular. I hope they pass this along to the Club personnel.

Reviews.Title: “Missed the mark for Christmas”
Reviews.Author: scooteratl
Reviews.Content: Chose e Drake this Christmas over the Conrad based on a friends advice. I was a little disappointed. The Drake starts check in at 3 pm but even with our Hilton honors privileges,rooms were not ready. Had a junior suite and executive level deluxe room. One room was not ready until 5:45 pm. So we had to camp out in one room for awhile. Once we got in rooms we noticed our sheets were torn, and the junior suite had a moldy smell. Had to call and ask for robes. Ordered room service breakfast and it was delivered on time but no fluff, no garnish on plates no flowers. Nothing! Executive level lounge one floor up and nothing to write home about. Drake needs to implement some extra amenities if they want to attract an upscale price. Will choose the Conrad over drake. The Conrad really makes Hilton honor guests feel special.

Reviews.Title: “Grand-not so sure!”
Reviews.Author: corleone57
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the grand hotels of Chicago. Many a famous person has stayed here. We stayed in a king deluxe room. I must say the room was laid out nicely. The fan for the heat control ran constantly eventhough on auto setting. This made it hard to sleep because of the noise.The bathtub had mold around the fixtures and when I closed the shower curtain closed, there was a strip of mold running down the curtain. I think this grand old place deserves more care. I'm not sure if it was worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great with Hilton HHonors benefits...wary otherwise”
Reviews.Author: ben1233
Reviews.Content: Although the Conrad is a favorite of mine, I thought I'd give the Drake a shot since I had reservations at Spiaggia on the evening of 12/17. As others have mentioned, the Drake is an acquired taste with many old-world, charming qualities. But at times, it wore thin. A lot of the woodwork was dinged up, the rooms are a tad awkward, and the plumbing is weird. My room's shower took forever to drain. I stood in 2 inches of water while showering. The toilet flusher was mounted on the wall like a joystick. Odd, but this is what I expected and it truly is a treasure for an old hotel...of sorts. As a Hilton Gold, I was given access to the Executive Lounge which was a treat. I was denied both an upgrade and/or a lakeview room, so I think this was the consolation offering. All in all, I was happy with the lounge. This was easily the highlight of the trip since the lounge had a jaw-dropping view. Based on what I've read, lounge access as a Gold (and sometimes as even a Diamond) is tough due to the small size of the lounge, which is only accessible via stairs. At the valet, they seemingly lost my vehicle as I stood there waiting for 50 minutes at which point I contacted the front desk manager. The manager was apologetic and comped the $50 parking fee. If I had not contacted the hotel manager, I wonder how long I would have waited.... All in all a good stay, but it is an acquired taste. I'm more a fan of the Conrad (personal taste) and would probably stay there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Always a fabulous experience”
Reviews.Author: Keith C
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently to Chicago and this is the only hotel I stay at. I was there in August, September and November this year. Bell staff is excellent, rooms are always top notch. The restaurants have excellent menus. The rooms are always clean. The location can't be beat if you want to shop or walk the lakeshore.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: AmazonKaren
Reviews.Content: In town for the Bears game. Stayed there 12/18. Rates were very reasonable. Could not get an early check in, because of it being full the previous evening. Booked a King room with sofa sleeper. Lobby was fantastic; so well decorated and bustling with activity. Front desk people were so friendly and helpful. Bell Hop/Car Hop service was fantastic. We really had to pull up and leave to get to the game, and they took care of everything. Elevators had seats in them. Hallways were wide and well lit. Room was VERY nice size. VERY. Bedding was wonderful. Sofa was as good as a sofa bed could be. Pillows were wonderful. Had drinks later in the bar on the ground floor. The bartender could have used some personality, but oh well. One small glich. I even lost a glove, and they had it bagged, tagged, logged in lost and found!! WOW!. It was such a classy upscale old world elegance that is so very missed in the new hotels of today. Even though it is old world, they did offer so many little perks, like a retractable mirror in the bathroom, extra outlets, a walk-in lit closet, safe in the room, high end bath accessories, gormet coffee. They really do make the extra effort to make your stay wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Old School ambience, exceptional service, active lobby”
Reviews.Author: ststephen33
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 16 days here on business, and I loved the feel of the hotel. It seemed to be from a diifferent era - the wonderfully decorated lobby was bustling, they serving high tea daily which was very popular, and there were parties, meetings, and gatherings of all sorts in the various banquet rooms. A nice change from the sterile lobbies of most chain hotels. The service was impeccable, the room was very comfortable, and it is nicely located at the top of Michigan Avenue with its crowds of shoppers. I got a little tired of the menu, but that is probably more because i was there for so long. Still the only thing that i thought was exceptional was their signature "Bookbinder" soup, a tasty tomato-based fish soup. I'd recommend it if you have the budget, appreciate really good service, and do not mind busy public areas.

Reviews.Title: “The Drake, not what we thought...”
Reviews.Author: Susan H
Reviews.Content: I had always heard wonderful things and had always wanted to stay at the Drake. From the minute we arrived it was downhill! I've never had a worse experience and would NEVER recommend this hotel to anyone! The staff was the rudest I've ever come across. No smiling faces, no welcome or even a hello. At one point when leaving..I gave up after waiting over an hour for our bags to be taken down and carried them myself. Only to find staff standing around doing nothing! once in the lobby. To top everything off we even got a dirty room, then when my credit card bill arrived I was overcharged 3 times what our check out statement said...I had to call 3 times to resolve, I never got a call back from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Elegancy of another age”
Reviews.Author: Marc S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very elegant and historic with rooms who get the view of Lake Michigan. Some of the rooms can be very romantic, other kind can be small and dark, all depends of the budget! Now as an old fashioned thing, there won't be wifi but they do have a hard wired internet connection. The hotel lobby court is wonderful for drinks and a snack with nice music. The Drake does housekeeping very well, excellent soaps, shampoo, conditioner & body creams as well. The food is also quite good, the Palm Court is a true delight. Service is as it should be... quick, seamless... What I don't like : papers on the walls and some cheesy stuff that make the decor overdated. The hotel needs renovation to enter 21th century. Cherry on the cake : Drake is extraordinarily convenient to shopping inner or outside with Rush Street about a 5 minute walk away...

Reviews.Title: “One of the loveliest experiences we have ever had”
Reviews.Author: Wahoo428
Reviews.Content: My husband is from Chicsgo and still loves to visit. On his 70th birthday, I took him to The Drake fo a special treat and what a treat it was! We had a reservation on the concierge floor, but because of the birthday, we were upgraded to a suite overlooking the city and the lake. It was a stunning view! Then later, they sent up a delicious chocolate cake and a bottle of champagne. Beautiful hotel and beautiful service! Can't wait to go back! We loved every minute of it.... Thank you, The Drake for making a Our trip so memorable!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful old hotel, historic and elegant.”
Reviews.Author: wheresheroams
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful weekend here. The location was good - far from the park perhaps, but still close to great night life. We had a view of the lake - which was very nice. It was a bit pricy, considering the expensive daily parking fee. Also - wifi was not included, which was a bit of an annoyance when it was openly free all over the city. Next door to the WaterTower place, which has a great lounge with views of the whole city.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best!”
Reviews.Author: obapwn
Reviews.Content: We looked forward to staying at the Drake. Although the hotel is slightly dated, it is not worn. The staff is excellent and the location is wonderful - especially for shopping in downtown Chicago. Cost is high, but the value is there for anyone who wishes to stay in a comfortable, professionally run hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Calyan
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a Hilton and while there is usually nothing wrong with them, they don't generally sparkle. This hotel however was a real surprise. First of all, the location is extremely helpful being close by to the nearby beach and all the shops in Chicago as well as some great restaurants. The rooms were perfectly nice and all the staff were extremely helpful. Overall this was a great hotel which I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago Tradition”
Reviews.Author: LUVSHOPPING
Reviews.Content: Location of this hotel is the best and you do not need a car by staying here. Everything is at your fingertips from a walk along the beach to shopping on the Magnificent Mile. Renovations have paid off to make the rooms updated. Comfy bed! If you go during the holiday season, the decorations are lovely and traditional. Service is outstanding and the housekeeping staff did a superb job each day of my stay.

Reviews.Title: “great time”
Reviews.Author: kelly s
Reviews.Content: it's a beautiful hotel. very happy staying there. NO SMELL at all as other people are saying. the rooms were clean, big and cosy. the personnel very kind and helpful. Also the location was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service at this classic luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: ILBadgerFan
Reviews.Content: My wife, one-year old daughter, and I stayed at The Drake the weekend of the Lights Festival for combined business and pleasure and had a wonderful time. We were expecting it to be similar to The Palmer House because they are both older, luxury hotels in Chicago that are now owned by Hilton and have been recently renovated. But, while The Palmer House is very good, The Drake was excellent. We stayed in the King Bed Deluxe room and it was very spacious and comfortable. The closet and bathrooms were a good size. The interior of the hotel is very tastefully done. Having stayed at other hotels we have liked in the past such as the Hotel Monaco and The Palmer House, the place where The Drake truly separated itself was in the exceptional service. We had some minor issues with a partner of The Drake through which we bought a shopping package and my wife had multiple communications with Stefan the manager at The Drake, and he was tremendous in his prompt responses (typically in under 1-2 hours), and he had this other company fix the issues immediately. Also in the Drake Brothers restaurant were we had complimentary buffet breakfasts (also through the shopping package we purchased), Gisele one of the employees there went above and beyond what we would expect even from an upscale establishment. There are many great hotels in Chicago but my wife and I agree this is definitely one we will return to the future, especially if we need to be in this Magnificent Mile/Gold Coast area again.

Reviews.Title: “old school - luxury hotel, you'll love it.”
Reviews.Author: Canneto79
Reviews.Content: magnificent, old fashion, luxury hotel. Very large, rich and super clean rooms, with super comfortable huge bed... nice but small bathroom compared to the room. Perfect location in Chicago, on Michigan "shopping" ave. Definitely one of the best hotel I have ever been. Just stayed for one night but I will be back. Nice big Christmas tree in the hall (...but this is the time of the year..)

Reviews.Title: “First rate”
Reviews.Author: mcdewey
Reviews.Content: Great service from all the people that worked there. Our room had a view of the lake. We love the location at the north end of the Mag Mile. At 200 dollars per night its a great value and we stay there again any time we are in chicago

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Grand Dame... Fabulous Location, Service”
Reviews.Author: WINEandTRAVEL
Reviews.Content: Stayed for the first time recently and was pleasantly surprised. Great location and super comfortable beds. As a Diamond member, we had a access to the Executive Lounge and that was nice... Lavazza Italian coffee machine was fantastic, basic continental bkfst was good, not great... but well staffed and stocked. Amazing views if facing the water/lakeshore dr. A ton of people work here... this is one place where they didn't cut back on staff... and it is well appreciated. Enjoyed this place a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Treat yourself to the Drake.”
Reviews.Author: srnwood
Reviews.Content: In the Windy City for a convention, this time I chose to stay at the Drake. In every way, I am so very glad I did. It was a good walk up Michigan Avenue, only a mile or so from the convention, and a quick taxi return. Located on the shores of Lake Michigan, next door to the wonderful view from the top of the Hancock Building, the Drake Hotel beats the Marriott any day! Itâ€™s a timeless beauty with everything you want in a hotel. Actually, last week I was in another city in another historic hotel, a hotel also owned by Hilton. Both similarly-priced hotels are located in their cityâ€™s heart, have ornate lobbies, beautiful carpeting in the hallways, LavAzza coffee in the rooms, Peter Thomas Roth soap in the bathrooms, identical ice buckets near the large screen television, and so on. Yet there is no comparison. Not only do you get a terrycloth robe, the Drake is rich with history. Marilyn Monroe and Joe DiMaggioâ€™s initials are carved in the bar, Princess Dianna slept here, and high tea at the Drake is still one of those must-do experiences when visiting Chicago. My room had three large widows, a shower and a tub, a separate study, and plenty of good lighting with multi-settings on all lamps. The room was large, well appointed, and incredibly clean. I purchased the bed and breakfast option at this beautiful landmark hotel. The bed part could not have been better, due in part to the blackout shades behind the windowsâ€™ sheers. Breakfast in the Drake Brothers Restaurant was perfect. Normally priced at $23, itâ€™s a lavish buffet with especially lovely Virginia ham, salmon, breads, and berries. They gave me a handful of extra coupons and some friends joined me for a leisurely meal. The Drake Hotel is uniquely superb. It is immaculate, well maintained, and hopping. Then again, in this age of economic downturn, so is Chicago. Unlike so many other cities, this one seems to be thriving. Treat yourself to the Drake. You wonâ€™t regret a stay at this classy place.

Reviews.Title: “Do not book here- stay at the marriott!”
Reviews.Author: baappleton1984
Reviews.Content: We reserved this room on priceline for half off the normal price. We then called to make sure the room would have two beds- which was an additional 70, of course. Room was okay- minus the roach we found in the bathroom and the faucet that wouldn't turn off, way to go green! The bar staff in the lounge was rude and spent his time ignoring us- had to wait over a half hour for the check. He must have thought the girls splitting the salad would tip more. During the check out process, the computer system was down. After waiting 10 min she reported there was nothing she could do- so she would email us a receipt. We had to call again and they had to resend it to us since emails apparently take 10min to an hour to be received. Funny since we got the resent one right away! We then noticed an extra 200 fee for the room with two beds on top of the already charged price. Also, the adjoining parking garage was 70 total plus 10 for having an suv. Not to mention them not being able to make change or losing the keys. Overall, I recommend the marriott next door.

Reviews.Title: “One night in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: PhatTone
Reviews.Content: Helpful staff, beautiful room, a really elegant place to stay. Great location by the 'Magnificent Mile' and a few yards from the lake. Really enjoyed my stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury without attitude”
Reviews.Author: Hope1215
Reviews.Content: This is just a great hotel, worth the splurge. As everyone states, location can't be beat. It's on Michigan avenue (or almost) -one of the main streets for shopping, near plays, etc. The ambiance of the various lobbies, lobby lounge and restaurants were welcoming and enjoyable. Rooms were nice, very clean, yes, old but definitely showed loving care to restoration. Ample outlets, which was surprising in an older hotel. All staff were friendly and helpful without any old world 'holier than thou' attitude. That was a nice change from some of the other historic hotel counterparts. Just off the main hotel lobby is an indoor shopping area which also housed a very casual coffee shop if one wanted a less pricey beverage, muffin, etc. We hope to be back again very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Old Classic hotel - well worth a try.”
Reviews.Author: Bringstheeagle
Reviews.Content: Drake Hotel - Chicago 25 Oct 2011 Aestetics: This hotel is old, classic and classy. Â The location is exceptional and everything in the area is pristine and upscale - really showcases Chicago at its best and classest.Â  Hotel Staff: I found all the hotel staff friendly and customer oriented. The young lady at the front desk was exceptional - friendly, efficient, and interested in assuring that I enjoyed my stay - very friendly and engaging. The room service folks were also especially helpful.Â  Hotel Room: My room was spacious and clean with a bar. The room was old but well maintained and clean with new carpets and fixtures Â Everthing worked and the closet was especially spacious. Â The mattress was also very comfortable.Â  Location: The location is excellent - upscale restaurants are located on the premisis and shopping is outstanding.Â  Technology:Â There are not enough plugs in the room or near the beds but I'd still rate them above average. I did not use their business center so it's not included here. The radio allowed the plugin of an MP3 Player which I always appreciate. Also had flat screen HD TV. Â  No wifi in the rooms - disappointing in today's world - even the Drake can't get away with that - not good a must fix. General Features and Safety: my room had a Fire Alarm and Fire Sprinklers - always a plus. The bathtub and shower were tricky at first as I couldn't get water flowing but a call to the front desk fixed that.Â Â The elevator was Â fast I always love that in any hotel.Â  Overall: This hotel is exceptional and an excellent solid bet for all travelers - road warriors and families alike. I would stay here again and will highly commend it to friends and colleagues alike as a definite good solid choice in the area. Â I also plan to return and bring the wife I'm sure she will love it as I do.Â  I am dissipointed that when I had to cut my trip short they charged me a half days lodging. Even for the Drake Â or perhaps especially for the Drake I found that a shoddy pratice clearly since I checked out in the morning the undoubtedly they sold the room again with little effort.Â  Also, had a tough time getting a cab each day - the bellman said it was because their hotel taxi lineup is at the end of the line - so word to the wise, if you want to make your meeting on time get your taxi early.Â  Oh, well I shall return - it is the Drake after all hrs an excellent place to stay and play.

Reviews.Title: “It's old school but I love this place”
Reviews.Author: thirty-something72
Reviews.Content: I hadn't been to the Drake for years but recently stayed two nights. It's your best example of an old hotel that has been very well maintained. Room was clean and bathroom large and very clean. Great location and staff. I'll be back. If you love modern hotels you won't like the Drake... but I love this place. Proximity to beach and great walking/neighbourhoods is a big plus.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; room a little tired”
Reviews.Author: Yellowlab3944
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the location for access to shops, restaurants, Lake Michigan. Rooms comfortable, but looks like the place could use a refresh - knicked woodwork, old wallpaper, dated interior design.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, historic and a must stay if in Chicago.”
Reviews.Author: Outofdodge_10
Reviews.Content: Elegant, historic and classy. Rooms are very nice and the staff is, as well. You will probably want to get a lake view room. If there are issues, the staff always takes care of them. Great location. I love The Drake. A fantastic place for a Chicago wedding, as well.

Reviews.Title: “A True Jewel of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Jetjouster
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is beyond words. Just the experience of having that much history around you and the level of professional service at your fingertips is incomprehensible. The rooms have everything you would expect. The Lakeview is breathtaking. The bar and restaurant is superb. The bar has REAL professional bar tenders, not drink slingers. The restaurant's fair of steak and seafood was perfect, the staff, perfect and the food perfect. Decorated beyond words with finely appointed pieces throughout the hotel becomes an afterthought after a while. Itâ€™s everywhere you look, walk, see and touch. But you want to do one thing that you know not many people have done. Go downstairs to their restaurant, grab a drink at their small quaint bar and run your fingers over where Joe DiMaggio and Marilyn Monroe carved their initials in the old wood bar. To sum it up briefly, The Drake makes you feel like your somebody without even trying. Hats off to them.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FAFLANNOUDE
Reviews.Content: The Drake is a nice luxurious hotel, on the Magnificant Mile, you are in city center close to everything. with nice view to the lake which is 2 min walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, perhaps a bit expensive”
Reviews.Author: DesertDuck
Reviews.Content: The room was huge and the bed was the most comfortable we have ever had. There were some minor issues, but the staff bent over backwards to fix them, and were genuinely sorry (which is rare I find). The morning brunch was great. Location is excellent, a Walgreens close, and a Starbuck's, and Water Tower Place right nearby. I would definitely stay here again! I was using Hilton points, and the room would normally have been $250 a night, which is a bit steep, but you do get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Drake for business in October”
Reviews.Author: SuperTien
Reviews.Content: Nice elegant hotel, nice thread count sheets, love the lifts that have sofas inside too. Perfect location as well. Really reasonable nightly rate which was also a pleasant surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and classy”
Reviews.Author: fastvalves
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Drake. I felt like a movie star and the staff was so helpful. A beautiful hotel and very close to lots of things.

Reviews.Title: “total disappointment!!!”
Reviews.Author: marthajules
Reviews.Content: After being moved 3 times the room I was put in was filthy dirty with a lake view. The first lake view room I was shown stank of toliet drains!! They didnt charge for the 1st night but we were so disappointed after our high expectations it didnt count for any thing. Arrived at 12 pm and didnt get into room until 6 pm and we are only staying for 2 nights. If your coming to Chicago give this a miss!!

Reviews.Title: “First time and every time”
Reviews.Author: Faemuzzy
Reviews.Content: Have only been to Chicago twice and this is the location we will always return to - even though it's at the complete opposite end from McCormick where our conventions were. Stores and restaurants abound but the hotel itself is a Chicago landmark and the view over the lake from our room was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “I want to go back...”
Reviews.Author: huda42
Reviews.Content: I really liked the Drake. It is unique and embodies the heart of this beautiful city. In a time when all hotels are much the same it is rare to come across one with the charm of the Drake. I had never been to Chicago before but will certainly come back. It's not perfect, the bathrooms could be bigger and I was in room 150 which was billed as a lake view and had one but I imagine that higher up would be better. The breakfast buffet is excellent with lots of healty options. I look forward to my next trip and this time I won't be working..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Great view and value”
Reviews.Author: rohnerju
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the drake for 4 days, for our anniversary and business. We visit Chicago quite a bit, and we were both very impressed with this hotel. The location is perfect. It is right on Walton and MIchigan, and right across from the beach. The view was spectacular. Its hard to impress us, since we live on the gulf, but this room didn't disappoint. I recommend that you stay in a lakeview executive room. These rooms give you access to the executive lounge, which offers free breakfast, and free appetizers at night. We took advantage of that every day, and it was great. This hotel knocked out any other place we have stayed in the area. We usually stay at the Park Hyatt, but we have stayed at the Dana, Amalfi, Doubletree, Westin, Peninsula, etc. The service was better than any other place we have stayed. The concierge was top-notch, and went above and beyond for us. The decor is amazing, and the rooms are very spacious, and beautiful.....and the VIEW!!!! I will be back for RSNA, and I have referred it to everyone I know for future bookings. I can't wait to go back. My only recommendation would be for them to do something special for anniversaries. Anything would do, just a small gesture to make it a little more special. I was disappointed when I didnâ€™t get any ideas or response from the concierge or room service. Itâ€™s a low cost way to make someoneâ€™s stay much more memorable. Flowers, champagne, a small box of chocolates, anything would do.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel of Contradictions”
Reviews.Author: NYCTravelMan
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel and in such a great location! I stayed at the The Drake for two nights for a meeting. The Drake is on a great section of Michigan Avenue (Chanel, Louis Vuitton, Gucci are right there!) and one block away from the Hancock Building and the old water tower is nearly as close. The lobby of this hotel is gorgeous and the staff was all very helpful and nice. Its just stunning to walk in and see the public areas. However, the meeting room areas and sleeping room was a different story. My room was on the 7th floor facing Michigan Avenue. I'm happy to say that I could hear no sounds from the outside and the view was just fine for me (who's staying in their room anyhow!). Unfortunately, the rooms at The Drake are very noisy. From both neighbors opening and closing their Roman shades, staff hollering and shouting in the halls or using their walkie talkies at all hours to everyone's room doors slamming shut whenever they come or go. Its incredible that the housekeeping staff is so loud at this hotel. The room is somewhat sterile in its appointments and other than a mirror on the wall, I don't recall any other artwork. My bedskirt was ripped and stained - this didn't give me a confident feeling although the bed and pillows were very comfortable. The room was also the coldest hotel room I've ever stayed in. The air-conditioner was set at 66 degrees when I got into the room but even adjusting it to 80 degrees did not change the cold blast coming from it. Co-workers and I had the same situation - the only way to warm up the room was to turn the entire unit off. This is not acceptable. The meeting rooms were also unusually cold. Internet usage in the room is only by ethernet cord - there is no wireless in the rooms; however, the internet speed was fast which is usually not expected in a hotel. Several of the meeting rooms on the west side of the hotel have single bathrooms which is strange to be in a meeting and hear folks flushing the toilet. The door to one of the conf room bathrooms was not cleaned. While The Drake was fine, certainly it appears more focus is spent on the public areas than the rooms. I must note that the conference room staff and servers were fantastic and extremely pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “First time stay for a former native Chicagoan.”
Reviews.Author: RickieK62
Reviews.Content: Growing up in Chicago, I was always in awe of the history, the glamor and location of the Drake Hotel. During the many return trips to visit family, we always hoped that we could stay there. Fortunately on our last trip back, the travel gods smiled on us and we secured an excellent rate. To summarize, we were not disappointed and it was well worth the wait. Everything was first-class, check in, luggage service, room size and the friendliness of the staff. The location was excellent, smack dab in the middle of the Gold Coast area. Another couple who had never been to Chicago traveled with us and they loved the hotel also. Looking forward to our next trip to the Windy City and another stay at the fabulous Drake.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Elegance and Charm”
Reviews.Author: corkip
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at The Drake, we enjoyed the executive amenities ,the room was lovely and had a view of the lake.We enjoyed the Coq D'or and the location of the hotel was close to fabulous restaurants and great shopping. Concierge were helpful and sent us to a great restaurant within walking distance.I can't wait until my next trip to Chicago, we will be staying at The Drake.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Working Concierge Staff”
Reviews.Author: Laz1544
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently had the pleasure of spending three nights at the Drake on a pleasure trip to Chicago. Aside from the "Chamber-of-Commerce" view up the shore of Lake Michigan from our fifth floor room, we made numerous visits to the concierge desk, relying on the extremely helpful and engaging staff. We made our first contact with them via cellphone, enroute to Chicago to get some ideas about recreational opportunities in the central part of the city. Without hesitation, Andrea suggested taking a Chicago River architectural boat tour. It was a perfect choice for us to spend an afternoon catching up with old friends and learn a great deal about Chicago in the process. They also suggested two top notch restaurants for us, one for an early dinner before going to Second City on Friday night, another for an excellent Italian feast on Sunday. The Drake is a fine old hotel with a lot of charm and history. Our stay there was made nearly perfect by the hard working, friendly concierge staff. Kudos to them!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: sparky99Florida
Reviews.Content: Recently revisited the Drake and and forgotten how much I love this hotel. The location is perfect. Close to shopping and the lake. The rooms have the historic charm that's lost on so many new properties today...and they've been maintained beautifully and are so charming.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous experience”
Reviews.Author: SCNancylee
Reviews.Content: Hotel is full of history. Rooms nice, view great, short walk to beach, right near everything. Customer service top notch. Everyone was very attentive.It is ungodly expensive though. Glad the company was paying

Reviews.Title: “Historical hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: HeritageSoftail14843
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 5 nights for business, and had some pre-arrival concerns based upon the other reviews I read on this site. However, when I arrived on Sunday, my room was not ready. The clerk at first seemed unwilling to assist and basically told me to come back in 3 hours, however, after I explained that I was here on business and needed to change clothes and go to a meeting, he then upgraded me to an Executive Suite, which was very large and nicely decorated. The hotel clearly is old, but they have done a wonderful job of keeping the amenities and interior of the rooms updated while at the same time preserving the historical aspects of the hotel. The rooms are extremely large, and I was happy to realize that although an older hotel, I had no problems and was not able to hear noises from the adjoining rooms (something that can often happen at older hotels). The bell staff is great, and if you valet park you pay more, but then you have in-and-out privileges (otherwise if you self-park you do not). I did realize the in-room mini bar was not working and told them mid-week; I returned that evening with a note that said it had been unplugged, yet I had already tried that earlier in the week and it did not work. They never came back or asked about it so I opted to not utilize it (the cost was rather expensive anyway). The famous hotel bar is great, and very comfortable to have a cocktail and quiet enough you can have a discussion without having to shout yet you can also watch sports if you desire. The location is great - just off Michigan Avenue and within walking distance to all of the major areas downtown. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and will certainly stay there again if I am in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Old but still good”
Reviews.Author: genebeans
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights last week and the room was clean and hotel is in a great location for walking and getting cabs right in front etc. We only ate breakfast there and it was good and pricey as expected in a large city. We had no problems other than water pressure which others have written about and we had a problem with the room size as it was smaller than we booked and they agreed and applied a credit immediately so no problem there.We had a problem getting somone to help with our bags when we checked in but after that I guess management spoke to someone as i never noticed anyone having a problem again.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Property, Horrible Management”
Reviews.Author: Nancy H
Reviews.Content: This beautiful property has been greatly diminished by the lack of quality customer service, stemming back to a summer visit wishing to purchase a gift card on a Saturday afternoon. To my dismay, I am told this is not possible on week-ends due to the executive offices being closed. Given the run-around by the concierge and front desk receptionist, I left the hotel most disappointed and visited a neighboring property where I was greeted , served, and made to feel like a guest should. Upon writing a letter to the general manager, Mr. Russell Menkes, on August 2nd, 2011 , to date I have not even had the courtesy of a response, I am employed as a manager in the hospitality industry and find this most unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Hotel With Great Service”
Reviews.Author: LATraveler18
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for six nights in September. We chose the Drake for it's historic charm and it did not disappoint. All of the staff could not have been more courteous and friendly. The hotel location is fantastic, close to Michigan Ave and Oak St beach. The bike path is easily accessible for jogging and walks to the lake. We ate at the Drake Bros restaurant, the food was good and the service was very attentive. The High Tea was also very enjoyable, the scones and sandwiches were tasty and, again, the service was remarkable. My only complaint would be that the water pressure in the shower was extremely low, even after maintenance came to the room and changed the showerhead. Perhaps that's best the historic plumbing can do.

Reviews.Title: “Good hospitality, excellent location, functional but not modern luxury”
Reviews.Author: HindoostanWanderer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a recent business trip for six nights and was assigned a 'small' room with a partial view of the lake. Checkin on arrival was swift and courteous. The room was a tad musty when I entered but the air conditioning soon set it right. The Drake takes you back in time, with its dimly lit corridors, heavy carpeting, room decor but yet manages to retain fucntionality - so if you are one looking for the ultimate five star experience, perhaps you would be disappointed if you expect a hilton service and decor. Location deserves five stars...its right on the golden mile and a convenient walk to all the major departmental stores and fancy brand shops (especially when you have to bring those heavy shopping bags back). The oak street beach within walking distance is a good choice for the summer evening walks. The food was good and the staff courteous. Will I stay here again? Yes, perhaps, but not too often. The world is moving on and so should The Drake.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago's Lakefront Jewel”
Reviews.Author: MamaBagel
Reviews.Content: If you've never stayed at The Drake, you need to on your next visit to Chicago! This beautiful hotel is so reminiscent of another time, it simply oozes charm and history! The rooms are huge, very typical of the era in which the hotel was built. They are clean, well appointed and the views of the lake are incredible!! The staff is always so helpful and the public areas are immaculate. There is no other hotel in the city like it - she is in a league of her own. If you love history, elegance and old world charm, this is YOUR hotel! I LOVE The Drake!

Reviews.Title: “I will not stay again”
Reviews.Author: tiger1127
Reviews.Content: I love the location for Dake Hotel in Chicago, but this time we are very disappointed: 1. When we arrived at 4:15pm after 5 hours long drive, our connected executive rooms are not ready even I called days before to put the request and they told me that everything will be set, finally they have to give us two rooms with no connection. 2. The room is not clean, I saw spider webs in three different places, the bathroom is not even up dated. 3. The day before I arrived, I tried to make dinner reservation at International Club, I called concierge department, no one answer the phone and I left message and no one call back, so I called International club direct line and no one was answering and finally someone called back. 4. We had our 4 years old daughter went with us, on the day leave, I got my car, the valet guy asked me did she get a Drake bear, I said no, no one offered her, blessed that guy, he went inside got a bear fro my daughter. Over all, I will not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Tea Time at the Drake - expensive but gorgeous and memorable”
Reviews.Author: Clarissa12
Reviews.Content: The ambiance at the Tea Time at the Drake is gorgeous, where a harpist plays, noise of women chatting fills the space, and beautiful China are laid before the guest. There is a choice of many different tea, and a three-tiered plate with sandwiches and sweets are placed on the table, as well. The service was polite, but not particularly warm or friendly. However, our waitress did take our picture. We stayed for several hours. This is expensive, but it is one of the best ways to memorably enjoy Tea Time in Chicago. If you can afford this Tea Time, it is a must at least once in your lifetime. Just a note, if you are male, you will probably not enjoy this activity as much as the woman you are with.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Historic Property”
Reviews.Author: CCorrente
Reviews.Content: This is one of the most beautiful hotels I have stayed at. Wonderful experience, right on Michigan Ave., and within walking distance to anything you would want to do while visiting Chicago. The room I stayed in was next to the Princess Diana Suite who actually stayed in that room and looking into the room while the staff was cleaning it was absolutely breathtaking with the view of Lake Michigan. I ate at one of onsite restaurants and the food was fabulous. We will definitely stay at The Drake everytime we come back to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Want to feel elegant - stay at The Drake”
Reviews.Author: Patty_in_Cleveland
Reviews.Content: In Chicago for a conference, so didn't have a choice of hotels. But lucky us! We really enjoyed staying at The Drake - right on Michigan Avenue. On the main bus route, but more importantly if you love to walk - within walking distance of major attractions. And walk we did in every spare time we had. We even added a day on to do the Architectural Tours. A special shoutout to Andrea at the conciege desk who tirelessly helped us plan our trips for every single moment we had free. Her exuberance wanting us to 'Experience Chicago' flowed over to us and enjoy Chicago we did! Our room was great, the lobby special and the food both on our own and thru the conference could not have been better! We enjoyed knowing the history of the place and really liked how close it was to the beach. Yep a great place to stay - we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: PearlgirlPhxAZ
Reviews.Content: My stay at The Drake was wonderful from start to finish. Staff went out of their way to accommodate me from changing rooms to sending someone up to help me figure out the TV remote. I arrived on Prom night and the lobby was full of highschool students ready for a night of partying. I was afraid the noise may be heard in the guest rooms but I didn't hear a thing all night. The bed was so comfortable too. When my stay ended, I had a great send off when the door man was so pleasant and hailed a taxi for me.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: denverDonegalIreland
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Drake it is an well kept old type Hotel but with everything a good hotel should have Breakfast has it all (except full fat yogourt) service was excellent,in a great location for shopping,would reccomend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Drake still a winner in Downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: BobbieMac421
Reviews.Content: We had a delightful 3 day stay in the Drake. Service was as good as it should have been in this price range. The location could not be more convenient. Simply no issues and a nice room with a view of the lake as an upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Terrila
Reviews.Content: The Drake is a beautiful, old, very classy hotel. It's conveniently located on Michigan Ave., close to the beach and Hancock Tower, but several blocks from the train. Nice rooms, comfortable beds and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we expected!”
Reviews.Author: NNKAustin_Texas
Reviews.Content: We had always wanted to stay at The Drake....this was finally the chance and it was wonderful.... We had a King Deluxe with view of the lake with Executive access. The greeting right through to our departure was gracious and welcoming. Breakfast Buffet in the resturant was very good and the staff was delightful. Michigan Avenue is unbeatable. Cannot wait to get another chance to stay with them again.
