Reviews.Title: “Nighttime hotel security....Not so much!!”
Reviews.Author: mulski
Reviews.Content: Myself & 2 friends have been staying at The Drake one long weekend a year for over 12 years and on the Friday (1:30am Saturday morning) of this past Labor Day weekend our room was broken into. I was returning to my room when I saw someone I've never seen before walking towards me in the hall. After getting a good look at him, and making sure my friends in the room were still alive, I let the front desk, bell captain, and conciegre know what happend with a description of the burglar. I made 3 verbal reports (front desk & 2 with security) of the incident. About an hour after these reports were made security came to the room to get statements from my friends, at which time security asked 2x if we wanted to press charges; of course we said yes both times - why would we report the burglary if we didn't want to press charges ..... really??? Security kept saying it was our fault we got robbed. My question to them was...how did the guy get access to the interior of the hotel to begin with??, especially since they "supposedly" check guests after midnight for a valid roomkey before giving them access!!!! So, either they don't check everyone for a current roomkey, he has an OLD roomkey (that they haven't changed for a while & therefore can't tell if it is current) or he is an employee!! After 2 more hours Chicago Police showed up to take their report. Here's where it gets crazy!!! While giving the Police our report, hotel security told us that we would have TO WAIT UNTIL TUESDAY (3 DAYS AFTER BEING ROBBED) before anyone at the hotel would look at the security video..HUH??? wait 3 days!!! What are they waiting for? Enough time to doctor the tapes & date/time stamps??? Thank God no one got hurt!! Chicago Police called me that Wednesday to follow up BUT also told me that THEY were STILL WAITING on hotel security to get with them!!!! AND was told by the hotel that there are ONLY SECURITY CAMERAS AT THE MAIN ENTRANCE!!! To this day, now 9 days since the burglary, NO ONE from the hotel has contacted any of us to follow up!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Old Place”
Reviews.Author: ben17a
Reviews.Content: The Drake is one of those great, old downtown hotels. I am an old hotel lover, but if you want to stay in one, you need to understand that they are "different." Walls aren't real thick, bathrooms can be strange. The Drake however, is in great shape and staffed by good people. My wife and I showed up on a Sunday morning at 9:00 AM and of course our room wasn't ready. But the staff parked our car ($50 valetâ€¦it is Chicago) and the Bell Captain secured our luggage. The concierge gave us maps and directions to the "L" and off we went to the Cubs game. We came back and checked in and enjoyed our room overlooking the lake. The room was very nice and the bathroom, while over 100 years old, is upgraded to current standards without losing the charm. The management of the hotel is excellent (look at his responses in below postingsâ€¦.what GM gives his e-mail?) I contacted him before my stay to arrange some things and he took good care of me, including making sure I had a lake-view room. The hotel is also in a great location. I loved the Drake; just one of those old-school downtown hotels that I love, and this one is top notch!

Reviews.Title: “Overall: Waay Over Rated - Great Lobby, Location - DUST DUST DUST”
Reviews.Author: FloridaJayBird
Reviews.Content: This historic hotel's best days have come and gone. Setting aside the obvious great location and interesting old lobby, this hotel has found its niche in DUST. Holy dust bunnies, I haven't been in such a diseased, sick, and dirty hotel in a long while, now i remember why. I was really looking forward to the stay, which is why I gave this museum a two-star rating. It probably deserves a three star, as the hotel bar is a cool little spot. But really and truly, I got sick during my stay as did my many friends who stayed as well. My room had major accumulations of dust underneath beds, furniture, whatever. To make matters worse, underneath the desk in our room were raisins, cranberries and and other candy.(at least i hope thats what that was) I am sure this place was great back in the day. But for all of you readers, those days are over and unless they spend some money to update the rooms, bathrooms and hire more, better or different housekeeping - this place will stay on my DONT list for Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “A true classic and a must when you visit Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Billingsontour
Reviews.Content: This is one of the worlds great hotels and as a frequent business travel it is great to stay in a hotel with some much character and history from the grand stair case to the Cote D'dor bar located on the grand level this hotel has some great stories to tell. The rooms are large although the bathrooms are a little on the small side. The Starwood Lounge on the top floor although a litte hard to find has incredible views down Chicago's Gold Coast I will be back

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful old hotel”
Reviews.Author: idiversue
Reviews.Content: Came here for a romantic weekend.Booked hotel directly,they mis spelled our name,thank goodness I brought my confirmation # or it would have been a disaster. Anyway,we got our room and it was very comfortable. The conciergesd were wonderful and gave us lots of ideas for lunch and dinner. The location was perfect and we could walk everywhere. Beds were super comfy too! All in all a nice placebo stay.

Reviews.Title: “A legendary hotel..fell short of expectation.”
Reviews.Author: annabanana1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Drake as we were in Chicago for health reasons and The Drake offered a reduced rate. We figured we would take that opportunity to enjoy this legendary hotel. While the lobby, bar, and ballroom are all elegant, well maintained, and beautiful our room wasn't exactly the same quality. The room size was massive but there wasn't a whole lot of furniture so there was just a lot of strange empty space. Our room was about 30 feet from a residential building (alley facing) and we could see into people's apartments and they into our room. That wasn't a big deal but it caused the room to be dark and gloomy. The window was inoperable and we found our room to be quite stuffy. The bed was moderately comfortable but the pillows were too soft for my husband and there weren't alternatives. I have severe rheumatoid arthritis and felt very sore after sleeping in the bed. The bathroom was awkward and outdated. The toilet was strange-very very old and it was literally two inches from the tub! There was no vanity space and no place to put make-up, brushes, products, etc. Overall the storage in the room was very poor. I just left everything in my suitcase as there was no other place to put stuff. The TV was barely usable. Thru must have the wrong cables for an HD TV as everything we tried to watch had squiggles all over the screen. Our clock radio was broken so there was no entertainment in the room. The one great thing at The Drake is the gym. If you like to workout on vacation you'll be impressed by this gym facility!! It was awesome. Too bad the rest of the hotel isn't as great. Valet parking is $50 a day so take that into account for overall cost.

Reviews.Title: “Charming lady of indeterminable age”
Reviews.Author: CillaBang
Reviews.Content: I booked this on Priceline with a bid and got a great deal. On arrival I was given a wonderful large executive room with enough space for a family of four. Having a bathroom with a window is a rarity anywhere these days which made it feel a bit more habitable. Service was great, really friendly. The Hotel does have that 'old world' although slightly crusty feel to it, but that's a matter of taste. One of the staff showed me the ballroom and its a really classy location. There were some long waits at reception during both check in and check out procedures as well as with a help request but overall its a good hotel and a great location if you want to be in the city.

Reviews.Title: “A Dump - Hilton Should Be Ashamed”
Reviews.Author: TrudiePru
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Drake for business, I'm very disappointed in the appearance and general disrepair of this historic property. The rooms aren't clean and smell like mold. The entire property needs to endure a major renovation. Shame on Hilton for allowing this property to fall from grace.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: cleanhand13
Reviews.Content: We stayed here this past weekend on the 10th floor - the executive level. It was amazing. The rooms were huge and clean. The view was beautiful. Being able to go to the executive lounge was a really nice perk - breakfast, beverages during the day and appetizers at night! The location is perfect. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...shame about the bathtubs.”
Reviews.Author: MegaraMcT
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our wedding night in this hotel, which had a special meaning for us as it was where my grandparents spent their wedding night in 1946. That said, The Drake has been lavishly restored and all its beautiful original designs and architectural highlights preserved. We had a stunning view of Lake Michigan and the staff spared no expense looking after us and ensuring that our stay was special. We were upgraded from a lake view room to the Senator's Suite! The suite consisted of a very cozy and comfortable bedroom with a truly amazing bed, a standard bathroom and a ridiculously large open plan living room/dining room. Bizarrely we were in one of the most luxurious rooms in the hotel and it didn't feel that...comfortable. Although it was spacious beyond belief it was sparsely furnished and a bit soulless, and the bathroom was nothing to write home about. I believe that all the bathtubs in the hotel are the originals, which means they are small and shallow; I would have expected the Senator's Suite to come with a sumptuous bathtub large enough for two, and it was beyond disappointing that it didn't.

Reviews.Title: “" Wonderful Stay at a Great Hotel "”
Reviews.Author: Ang6768
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at The Drake from July 17th to July 22nd on the Great Getaway Package to celebrate our 45th Anniversary and were upgraded to a Beautiful Suite with a Lakeview. What a great staff at The Drake. Everyone was so gracious and friendly from the Doorman ( Ben ) who greeted us with a smile when we arrived at 930am Sunday morning to the front desk and housekeeping. Mary made sure we had extra towels and our room was always perfect, thank you Mary. The breakfast buffet was outstanding and the waiters (Tomas and Guillermo) were top notch. A Special Thank You to Russell Menkes & Christine Folz for the champagne, the chocolate covered strawberries, early check in and the upgraded room. WOW, what a nice touch for a Special Occasion. We LOVED our stay at The Drake. You have dedicated employees and it shows. They obviously enjoy working for you. Kudos to your team! We hope to see all of you again when we visit Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Some minor issues, but definitely worth a look.”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan G
Reviews.Content: Situated in a great location at the north end of Chicago's Magnificent Mile, The Drake remains a classic gem of a hotel, and surprisingly affordable for such a renowned name. Rooms were clean and comfortable, with good lighting throughout. The layout of the room did leave some to be desired, with television and small couch on opposite ends (I assume this is a product of the older design of the building). Still, a lovely and well-maintained property, and definitely worth a visit. Other notes: Hotel is located along Michigan Ave., so catching a city bus generally means only a few minutes' wait, if you opt not to walk. Subway is a couple blocks west. Don't bother paying extra for "City View" rooms - more often than not, your view will be of the rooftop A/C machinery. Hotel places a $100 hold (per day reserved) on credit card upon check-in, to cover incidentals. Maybe a deal-breaker on a long stay.

Reviews.Title: “Why is this hotel not number ONE????? it should be!!!”
Reviews.Author: stephaniefromcanada
Reviews.Content: Just returning home, from what maybe our best vacation EVER!!!! My husband and I decided to share our 20th anniversary vacay with friends!!...We all decided to take the Executive Suite option, allowing us a central and relaxed meeting spot, and the most spectacular view each and every morning for breakfast!! The staff, the rooms, the location, everything was amazing about this hotel!! We loved the nostalgia and the elegance!! and it was the foundation of a fantastic time!!!...we will be returning to Chicago...and the ONLY hotel we'll even consider will be the Drake!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and value for money!”
Reviews.Author: cmtreloar
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best hotels I have stayed in for a long while. It was in a great location and we had views overlooking the lake (definitely worth the small upgrade fee). The place was very clean, the rooms were huge and the staff very friendly. This is an excellent location to walk to almost everything. It is not far from the Lincoln Park Zoo and right on the shopping strip. I would for sure stay here next time I come to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay and affordable at a 4 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: suziedon
Reviews.Content: After living in Chicago most of my life I went back with friends for pleasure. What a great experience. Consierge service wonderful - got us into OPRAH the next day. Food great and service superb. 4 Star hotel with affordable rates. Clean rooms and spacious too.

Reviews.Title: “Classic luxury”
Reviews.Author: Villagequilter
Reviews.Content: We go to Chicago quite often, mostly to visit our daughter, but this time my husband had a business conference and I tagged along. We checked in late Sunday afternoon and I'm not sure if the doormen were understaffed or if there were some regulars that they were paying closer attention to but we had to unload half our luggage ourselves and carry them by hand up to the lobby on the main floor-one flight up. I was a bit disappointed by that level of service at such a reputable hotel. Check-in was smooth and our room more than I expected. We had a great view north overlooking Lake Shore Drive and the lake. The room was very spacious and the bathroom was not at all cramped. My husband was allergic to the down pillows and comforter but they sent up new pillows and remade the bed with blankets but left the comforter for me and left a nice note indicating which were the down pillows (for me) and the alternate pillows for him. The bar downstairs was very cozy and the bartender was extremely attentive. Loved the feel. Had breakfast in the dining room one morning and thought the one piece of French Toast was good but very overpriced. Next time I'd go for the buffet. The location was perfect in it was on the north end of the Miracle Mile and only a few blocks from the "L". My only other complaint was the workout room. It was in 3 separate rooms all requiring a key to enter each. I like to do a circuit and it would have meant going between rooms. Not terrible but just inconvenient. I would stay here again because of the convenience and the comfort of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: JoeTea
Reviews.Content: From the minute we arrived this was clearly a special hotel. We had paid a bit more for an Executive room with a lakeview but even so we found the service to be great. In particular, the Front Desk were really helpful when I discovered I had dropped my mobile in the taxi from the airport and managed to get it back for me. They also put a birthday cake for me in the room which was a nice touch! All the staff were very friendly and we had absolutely no complaints about this hotel. The room was very clean and the bed just made you never want to get up!

Reviews.Title: “Love The Drake”
Reviews.Author: newindigo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Drake in July and It was exceptional. Great rooms, the Bar on the main floor was awesome. Got a deal on Expedia and paid less than our friends who stayed at the courtyard. Will defiantly be back.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: ST61938
Reviews.Content: i stayed here a few nights on business. i really enjoyed the "old-world" charm of this place. Some of the older hotels tend to have that old architecture, fixtures, wallpaper, etc and it shows. This hotel did not have that. It is now a hilton owned hotel, my understanding for several years now... It has been cared for in a very nice fashion, where the older touches are in very good shape - the elevators with a small bench and light fixtures with little shades. The hotel uses high quality toiletries, and the room was clean and reasonable sized, especially for an older hotel - built in 1920's i believe... The staff was awesome here - informative, welcoming, etc etc. The bell captain was very welcoming, the desk staff was welcoming and informative about the hotel history, all in all very nice touches... The gold coast room you should take a peek there floor to ceiling windows and magnificent views to boot. Really enjoyed my stay away from home. I was able to get a room at a good rate for this week, and wish i could afford to stay here more frequently!

Reviews.Title: “Grand ol' dame still speaks "luxury" and style”
Reviews.Author: mlhfoley
Reviews.Content: Fabulous three nights for 3 generation family visit! Reservations worked with me months in advance to get optimum suite and connecting room for 7. Executive lounge service was nicebut area is a bit small fornumber of clients. Housekeeping did get things in place after some calls. A/C had to be augmented with fans but enginer did that immediately. Views of Lake michigan were terrific and fun. Lack of free wifi was a downer and needs to becorrected. Overall a goid value and great location will return!

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: KRL724
Reviews.Content: The Drake Hotel is truly a Chicago icon. Its lobby is opulent; the staff is pleasant and accommodating; the rooms are spacious and clean...I could go on and on. Just let me tell you this--staying at The Drake will be a memorable, enjoyable experience! (BTW, if you fly into Midway, take the Orange line to the Red line (Chicago's public transportation system) and enjoy the short walk to the hotel. It will only cost you $2.25 per person! Far less than the shuttle services!)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for American girl Weekend”
Reviews.Author: nanna5indiana
Reviews.Content: The Drake was the perfect hotel for us. This was a girls weekend, with grandmother, daughters, and granddaughters spent at the American Girl Store. The Drake is only 3 blocks away perfect for little legs and heavy packages. I can't say enough about the kindness of the doorman. They always spoke to the girls, commented on their new dolls and pretty dresses. this was a special time for the girls and their attention was greatly appreciated. They gave us a late checkout on Sun. so we could attend the luncheon and not have to rush. Thanks Drake for making out girls' weekend that much better.

Reviews.Title: “Expected better from a hotel at this price”
Reviews.Author: madmimie
Reviews.Content: I don't like to complain but The Drake hotel was a little disappointing. We had booked 7 nights in mid July for a family superior room. Upon arrival we found our room on the first floor, with no view and unbelievable noise from the city traffic as well as the music and such from the lobby below. We asked to be moved and they were able to the next day. We upgraded to a beautiful executive suite on the 10th floor with an exceptional view of Lake Michigan and the beach. The view was awesome but the room was warm all the time (I guess the old A/C units couldn't keep up with the heat on the top floor) and housekeeping left a lot to be desired. Housekeeping was terrible. Left tables dirty with glasses we had used. Bathroom was not cleaned well yet they always seemed to find the tip we left Forgot to leave glasses and coffee etc. I would have to call down to get delivered. At other times housekeeping would walk in, without knocking at 9 or 10 in the morning...it was amazing! Did I mention our upgrade cost us an additional $!30 per night - on top of what we already booked for! A hotel at this price should treats guests better. I have stayed at many hotels around the world and am not very impressed. Also a hotel at this cost should offer wi-fi! That was very inconvenient. I must add though that the bell hops have to be the nicest, most courteous and helpful of anywhere I've been! If it wasn't for them...well, you figure it out.

Reviews.Title: “Still One of the Best in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelerOR
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our anniversary. We wanted to stay in one of Chicago's grand hotels with an excellent location for shopping and sightseeing. The Drake Hotel filled the bill. Beautiful room combined with excellent service and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Someday This Will Be a Nice...but as for today it's old and dirty”
Reviews.Author: I_am_reviewing_you
Reviews.Content: Why do people love this place? It's old, worn down, and dusty. Since photos say 1000 words, check out these 2 photos from my room: Photo 1 - The TV is not directly in front of the bed....it was literally a pain in the neck to watch. Whoever the interior design person is should be fired! Photo 2 - Amazing views out the window...if you are professional firefighter. Seriously, this is what I paid for??? Photo 3 - To disgusting to post...but there were mayonnaise stains on the bench chair at the foot of the bed...â€¦.ewwww. I am sure this hotel was nice at some point in time but it is not a hotel for the Modren Day Travelerâ€¦.my advice skip it!

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: BettyS10
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here numerous times and am always pleased! The valet staff is SOO friendly, just the nicest guys in town. The rooms are spacious and classic. I enjoy all the history of the hotel, I like to think of all the people that have stayed there in the past. The hotels's decor captures all the history. If you have breakfast, I highly recommend the pancakes! Their great! I just love this place! If you're looking for a true historic Chicago hotel this is it!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant surprise, we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: sewing3
Reviews.Content: The Drake Hotel in Chicago is a walk back in time to a beautiful, elegant, hotel with history and ambience. Located a couple blocks from Lake Michigan, some rooms with the lake view. Gorgeous lobby and and beautiful rooms with nice big bathrooms and a wet bar. It's located on the MIchigan Ave with blocks of upscale shopping and eateries too. A great place to get away and experience a old charm. The restaurants very upscale and a bar with Marylin Monroe and Joe Dimagio's initials carved in. The bellmen gave us a great tour with history. The service was great. Many famous people have stayed there thru the years , it was built in the 1920s. Fantastic place, we'll go back!

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: DeRo_11
Reviews.Content: Checked in to a lake view & saw nothing but a/c units. I asked for a move & was given an abstracted view the carpet was coming up & sheet rock fell from the ceiling. This was the worse hotel experience I've had, normally staying @ 5star this was below standard for $300 per night. Don't bother, a renovation is overdue.

Reviews.Title: “Grande Dame with a Few Gray Hairs”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTravelerDC52
Reviews.Content: The long history and stellar location of the Drake make it a fun place to stay. One really feels like he stepped off of Michigan Avenue and into Old Chicago when entering the lobby here. The hotel, though now clearly a fully-fledged Hilton, still retains many of the old characteristics of yesteryear, including elegant furnishings and unique carpeting. The service is, generally, very good, though the bellman should have offered to carry my luggage up the stairs to the lobby instead of just watching me carry the suitcase. The room was spacious and well appointed, and the executive lounge was one of the best I've visited within the Hilton chain. Still, there are signs that a renovation should come within the near future. Some walls have been painted over one too many times, and the bathroom plumbing could be a bit finicky at times. That said, despite the aging infrastructure the hotel was kept very clean and orderly. If given the choice between the Drake and other upscale chains (e.g. Marriott, Westin, other Hiltons...), I would choose the Drake again. If for nothing else, the history book about the hotel left of my coffee table was fun to flip through.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Drake - gorgeous hotel but some basic, fatal flaws that put me off”
Reviews.Author: Ascottowers
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at many other Hilton properties in Chicago over the years, I was always told that the Drake was by far the nicest of them all and that at some point I should attempt to stay there too. However, being constrained by travel budgets, their rooms have typically been over my limit. But this time I managed to bag a room for less than my max spend and decided to give it a go. I arrived direct from a long haul transatlantic flight into O'Hare tired and in need of a freshen-up. The doorman was polite and told me to go upstairs to registration. The hotel is indeed very nice in terms of furnishings and it was a pleasure to be surrounded by a hint of opulence. Registration took a while but the guy was a trainee and was at pains to get it right, which I didn't mind. They gave me a lake view room on the 6th floor and it was a lovely room, nicely appointed and a great view of Lake Michigan. Free coffee, alarm clock to which I could hook up my iPod, a big work space, roomy closet, comfy bed, spacious bathroom with nice toiletries. My stay was comfortable but I did have a few gripes, which I put in my feedback form back to the hotel management. They include: 1. No wireless Internet in the rooms, there is only a hard wired connection and in this day and age where folks are increasingly on the move with smartphones and tablets, not offering wifi is inexcusable. Not all of us bring clunky laptops to these hotels where you have to connect via a LAN cable. 2. No free water in the room. Normally, I would expect there to be a few free bottles of mineral water, on either side of the bed or on the main desk. All you get here is a huge glass bottle of Evian with a somewhat austere notice around the bottle's neck saying that you will be charged $7 should you dare to drink it. Ouch. 3. There was a mini bar but it was locked. Yes, go figure! And no sign of a key anywhere! Mind you with the prices of the drinks being so high, I as glad that I couldn't get into the bar. 4. While the buffet breakfast was nice in terms of quality and variety, the staff seemed a little on the tired, near surly side and seemed more interest in how much of a tip I left versus actually providing a nice service. In all, I enjoyed the furnishings of the Drake but I don't think I would stay there again. I travel a lot for business and the lack of wifi in the rooms killed it for me. I guess it would have been better, had I stayed their for fun/leisure, but I am not so sure given how the Internet is integral to our day-to-day lives. Let's see what kind of a response I get from the feedback form. I hope they view my criticism positively and work on it.

Reviews.Title: “What has happened?”
Reviews.Author: Porsche_8
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this Drake Hotel numerous times, but this time was quite different. Whereas their conference rates are usually quite good, this year they went up terribly. Many of our conference attendees stayed elsewhere this year. If the hotel doesn't return to their previously reasonable rates for conferences, I will probably stay elsewhere also. The internet costs to the hotel are high and they truly need a real coffee shop in the facility.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel...”
Reviews.Author: tootlepops
Reviews.Content: Upon writing this I have to say that I really enjoy the nostalgic feel that the Drake provides. I've stayed here three times while traveling to Chicago in a King Executive Lakeview Room. It is in a good location, near the main shopping area and restaurants...but still just enough out of the way to not be extremely noisy. My favorite parts...nice lake view from large picture windows, the doormen are exceptionally nice every year, the concierge are always extrememly helpful with reservations and made some wonderful recommendations they are also pleasant to speak with, good pricepoint as far as the rooms, and the Palm Court for music in the evening on the weekends. The Palm Court host some wonderful musicians and is a lively and elegant atmostphere for dancing, champagne and coctails in a candlelit, beauitful room. The food at the Drake is just average. We dine at many restaurants each time in Chicago, but will also try the restaurants at the hotels in which we visit. We have enjoyed the afternoon tea with a harpist. The room provides a lovely backdrop and atmostphere. The beds are comfortable and the bathrooms spacious and redone. The walls are a bit thin, so if you are light sleeper like myself...be prepared to hear your neighbors or those in the hallway. Overall...I would consider the public areas luxurious, the rooms average as well as the food. The service, very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location -skip the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Vacatrip1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Drake over Memorial Day, 2011. You can't beat the location! Our room was spacious and clean and also had a mini fridge. Bathrooms were just OK and could be updated. No free internet. We did the bed and breakfast package and were very disappointed in the quality of the Drake Bros. breakfast. Nothing tasted very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location little bit pricy”
Reviews.Author: amyt1985London
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with a group of colleagues and everyone thought the hotel was fab. The decor is a fairly traditional and although this is not my cup of tea I can appreciate that some people would love it. I had a corner room overlooking Gucci & Louis Vuitton which was spacious and clean. The F&B options in this hotel are great the breakfast in Drake brother is quite possibly the best I have ever had and I regularly stay in hotel for about 1 week every month. The main hotel lobby bar offer a fabulous afternoon tea, the Cape cod restaurant was amazing with a great atmosphere and exceptional service. The coq dâ€™or bar was very nice although very expensive. I would definitely recommend staying here

Reviews.Title: “A classic with some kinks”
Reviews.Author: An0nym0us
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the Drake for a meeting at the hotel. As a Hilton Diamond we were upgraded to a lakeview king executive room. There were a number of positives and negatives. First the positives: very comfortable bed, though pillows a bit thick for stomach sleepers. Magnificent view of lake and beach. The breakfast in the Concierge Lounge (10th floor, but one flight of stairs above where the elevator leaves you) was high-quality, though sadly lacking oatmeal. Quiet for the most part. Good shower and tub. Safe in large walk-in closet. Minibar refrigerator with enough room for personal items. Now the negatives: prior to check-in, housekeeping missed a used washcloth and showercap on the back of the bathroom door and a sugar packet on the windowsill. The TV remote did not work (a new one was provided promptly). The air conditioning could not lower the room temperature below 65, even when the outside temp was 51 (the windows have small screens but stickers saying â€œDo Not Open Windowsâ€�). A barking dog was heard from the adjacent room one day; this did not continue after it was reported to the front desk. As other reviewers noted, internet is wired-only with a short cord on the desk; download speeds seemed unusually slow. Management responded to the temperature problem by comping one night at checkout, this after promising to send an engineer to the room that never happened. Check-in staff were less than friendly. There was a closet which looked made for a wet bar and refrigerator but was empty. Ironically, I chose the room I stayed in after asking a hotel reservations staffer about the 4 rooms offered at on-line check-in. I should add that several of the meeting rooms were accessible only by stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!! Fantastic!! Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: badbullgator
Reviews.Content: Not a lot to say other than this is a top of the line hotel. Everything you would expect in a 5 star resort. Great staff, great rooms, beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful old world charm with updated amenities”
Reviews.Author: Suri22
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our anniversary at the Drake Hotel in Chicago. We live in the area so we just spent one night there. We were given an upgrade to a Jr. suite on a high floor facing Lake Michigan. I didn't want to leave the room. The room was beautiful with old world charm as was the entire hotel. Though we did not have dinner at the hotel that night we did enjoy the lovely afternoon tea service in the lobby. The staff was very welcoming and really made us feel like a special guest in their own homes. This is a wonderful getaway, especially if you are celebrating a special occasion.

Reviews.Title: “WARNING to Hilton Diamonds-Don't plan on Lounge Access”
Reviews.Author: jamesteroh
Reviews.Content: The room was ok, but was VERY DISAPPOINTED as a Diamond member not getting lounge access. The Hilton Website states: If you are a Diamond HHonors Member, youâ€™ll enjoy access to the Executive Floor lounge, even if you donâ€™t receive a room upgrade to the Executive Floor, including daily complimentary Continental breakfast. I have never been denied access to an exec lounge as a Diamond until this stay. When I checked in I was told no exec level room upgrades were available. Not a big deal, since it's space available. What WAS a big deal was being told that I couldn't have lounge access due to the lounge being small. I was told that it was a small lounge and the only people that got access were people in exec. rooms. No where did it say that when I booked the3 room (I was signed into my hilton account as a diamond member), on the drakes webpage or on the HH page. I have stayed at the Hilton chicago a few times and the Palmer house many times, and if I wasn't upgraded to the exec floor, I was ALWAYS given lounge access, and in fact at the Palmer house I was granted access to the lounge if I arrived early and my room wasn't avilable or after checkout if I had a late flight or was taking amtrak on a 6 p.m. train. If they aren't going to give lounge access, then it needs to be pointed out on their webpage when making the reservation, I would have stayed at the Palmer House or Michigan Hilton if I would have known that. Or at least give a voucher for an appetizer every day in the bar like properties do on weekend stays if their lounge is closed on weekends. The room was ok though and the staff was good. I didn't care for the location, it wasn't very close to the L. If you want convenient L access, stay at the palmer house. If you are a diamond and want lounge access, then definitely stay at the Palmer house or Hilton Chicago on michigan.

Reviews.Title: “Drake Hotel is pure class & service”
Reviews.Author: Hacklou
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel on Lake Michigan. Great location. Cape Cod restaurant is fantastic. 1 block from Mag. Mile Try to book on executive floor if possible to gain access to lounge on 10th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: bhighlande
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Drake for one night for our wedding anniversary. Were treated very well! Upgraded to a really nice Executive Suite and was surprised with free champagne and chocolate covered strawberries. Great bathroom. The free Honors breakfast was excellent. Will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice experience”
Reviews.Author: WannabeFoodieLV
Reviews.Content: We arrived early Friday morning after a red-eye from the west coast and was greeted by a very friendly smily doorman. Check-in was easy and efficient gave us our room immediately. Everyone was friendly throughout our stay and the accommodations were large and comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Treated like royalty...”
Reviews.Author: anderstein
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 7 wonderful days at this awesome hotel and highly recommend it. Service was amazing. All staff friendly and helpful. Rashawndra was wonderful in finding us the perfect room for our extended stay. Very patient and helpful. Concierge desk - Mary, Andrea and Ronald answered all our questions, gave us directions, restaurant suggestions and made reservations. Room was perfect - bed soooo comfortable. Will only stay here when we return!! P.S. It's the best location in the entire city!!

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated Old World Charm”
Reviews.Author: Darbydog6
Reviews.Content: A sophisticated old world charm greets you as you enter the lobby of this wonderful hotel. The hotel is immaculate. Rooms are spacious and the beds are divine. Staff is courteous and kind. Close to the Million Dollar Mile, it's shopping and wonderful places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Some amazing qualities......some definite signs of age”
Reviews.Author: itzMS
Reviews.Content: I will start by saying that there are definitely plumbing issues (as other travelers have stated). No, it's not awesome that the tubs do not drain and the temperature is hard to regulate. I didn't move to a different room as the inconvenience of changing rooms wasn't worth the hassle to me personally. Just be prepared that you ~will~ likely have to change rooms if these types of issues bother you. In addition, the hallway noise can be quite elevated in the morning. I observed the housekeepers and one or two supervisors/captains running around & speaking loudly on more than one occassion. The housekeeping staff here seems to work quite quickly & assertively (starting cleaning of rooms by 8AM), so be sure to put out your DND sign! The internet is also not wireless. Bring a longer ethernet cord with you unless you plan on only working at the desk with the short cord the hotel provides. That being said, the Drake is really a pretty sweet hotel. It is just so refreshing to stay in a hotel that is not a "cookie cutter" chain. There is history here, but it is well blended with very modern touches & conveniences (much appreciated). The room I stayed in had a walk-in closet as well as a safe which are two conveniences rarely seen in hotel rooms nowadays. The rooms (to my surprise) had a fully stocked minibar. I didn't purchase any of the items ($8-$12 for minis of liquor, $4-$10 for snacks), but I did empty out the small refridgerator and use it for my own beverages and leftovers. Again, a convenient touch.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected.”
Reviews.Author: CaseyC2
Reviews.Content: For as much as you are paying to stay in this hotel I expected better. The doormen are very welcoming and when you walk in the front door it's beauty really is overwhelming! However in my room I wasn't as impressed. The shower had mildew and the wallpaper was beginning to separate from the wall. The closet also had this random little door in the corner that, when opened, looked like a creepy little dirty crawl space. I'm not sure I would stay there again given the chance. Not worth what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Classic Uptown Luxury”
Reviews.Author: bonemechanic
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Drake for a business/leisure weekend. I was able to book a competitively priced room through the Hilton website. I chose The Drake as a local upgrade over where my meeting was scheduled. I enjoyed my stay from the curb-side bell captain to the waiter at the Cape Cod Room restaurant. The Drake is a whole new world in terms of room and amenities in the last two years.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place - highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: BostonMeg25
Reviews.Content: I loves my first visit to the Drake. The staff were so accomedating...automatically upgraded me to a deluxe room at no charge. (I had two bathrooms!) Found the rooms clean and VERY spacious. Front desk approved a late checkout (2pm) at no charge. If you're looking for a "new" hotel this isnt it -- but a place with charm, you got it! Would absolutely stay here again -- and what a good location on the magnificent mile, too.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst on the Mag Mile”
Reviews.Author: jsorcechicago
Reviews.Content: First let me say that I have never written a review before. Why? I have never been that dissatisfied to want to write one. I travel quite often for work and all over the world so my basis for comparison is quite good. I live in Chicago and decided to try the Drake for a "staycation" with my wife. I expected the Drake to be a little old but... Biggest issue The walls in the hotel are paper thin! You can hear the person in the room next door burp! The sound of doors opening and closing kept us up all night. And that was in our second room. What happened to thr first room? Other than the party in the room next door, everytime the heat turned on the room get this toxic smell similar to cigarettes and skunk. We are not typically complainers so we tried to ignore it. Couldn't do it. Called the front desk and they moved us ASAP. No questions asked which is why I give this hotel a good service rating. The location is great and the service staff does its best with what it has but frankly, for 100 more go ahead and splurge on the Elysian or the Trump and have no concern that one of your few nights alone with your spouse will be ruined.

Reviews.Title: “Not just a hotel, but an experience”
Reviews.Author: julia1606
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful, well-kept historic hotel, that will please just about anyone, but those desiring ultra-modern decor and design. We were upgraded (for a $25.per night rate) to a huge corner suite with two over-sized twin beds, overlooking the lake (a huge lake view!). The room was really tastefully decorated and it looked as though it had been renovated recently. The high tea in the Palm Court was excellent, as was the breakfast room service. It is a pleasure to just walk around the hotel, as all the common areas are gorgeous. Service is excellent--concierges especially helpful. Celebs and royalty have stayed here and I have to say that we felt almost famous. Michigan Avenue location is great--walking distance to the city's main attractions. Only negative was that the maids used a strong chemical product of some sort which bothered us one night, and so we had to request no more sprays.

Reviews.Title: “Classic elegance.”
Reviews.Author: AmyNNN
Reviews.Content: Great treatment start to finish. Got upgraded to a corner lake-view room even though I don't have high points status. Ate lunch in the bar two days. Bookbinders soup is delicious and the clam chowder is the best I've had - coast to coast.

Reviews.Title: “All Show No Go?”
Reviews.Author: dougclark67
Reviews.Content: I wanted to love The Drake and it's reputation had my expectations pretty high. Sadly though, it was a whole lot more show and a whole lot less go. The hotel itself is magnificent and the room exceptionally large and the staff for the most part were exceptionally friendly However, upon finding myself beyond ankle deep in water after taking a shower, a remote that went missing after the room was cleaned and the absurd cost of internet usage without wifi had me shaking my head. The drain was taken care of within about 10 minutes of calling. A replacement remote however took quite a bit longer. And the $24 per day for internet access seemed like the cheapest possible nickel and diming I'd expect from a $75 per night motel...not from The Drake. I was additionally a little confused as to why such an enormous bathroom was fitted with such a little tub & countertop. And despite the regal old school look, the walls were pretty thin and street/neighbour noise was fairly easy to hear. The next question being mandatory, I guess I'll throw in the caveat. The drain & remote admittedly were "bad luck"...but both easily avoidable by a hotel with this level of means. So, I'd recommend The Drake with a but...don't plan on using your notebook or smart phones to plan activities around town

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Spectacular, Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: Mamaj24
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at The Drake exceeded our expectations and then some! The hotel is absolutely gorgeous! Every employee is super friendly and always available. Check in went smoothly- we added on the Romance Package to our stay for my husbands birthday celebration and WOW! It was worth every penny! Our room was upgraded for no charge to an Executive Suite with Lakefront views, champagne was delivered to our room, late check-out and a DELICIOUS breakfast at Drake Bros- all included in the package! They even brought a special dessert to my husband on a plate decorated with balloons and Happy Birthday written on it in chocolate while we were enjoying the amazing breakfast buffet! The lounges in the hotel are so comfortable and inviting, the concierge is very knowledgeable and I have to admit, Im a big fan of the sofa in the elevator! :) My only disappointment was in the pillows- woke up with a stiff neck. A little too hard for my liking. We will be going back to this hotel for sure in the near future. We felt like royalty! A++++++++!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ctownhokie
Reviews.Content: Was a really nice hotel with excellent amenities. It is old and historic and well kept. Work out facilities were outstanding as was the food @ Cape Cod.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Carolmdent
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel. Clean, great location and great view.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: 5Merlin
Reviews.Content: The staff are friendly and helpful. Enjoyed the large tub, very comfortable bed, and nice sized room. Breakfast buffet was excellent; variety of breakfast items and option of cooked to order omelettes..Great fitness room with open hour access. Business center has several computers, but credit card needed for use. Great location with easy access to Gold Coast shops.

Reviews.Title: “What a Disappointment--Old and Filthy!”
Reviews.Author: Mel1997
Reviews.Content: The Drake Hotel is rich in tradition and history.....unfortunately that's all it's rich in. My husband surprised me with a weekender there for my birthday and aside from the grand entrance and a wonderful doorman, it was a disgusting mess! Our room, on the Executive Level-which we had to pay more for, had a lovely view of Lake Shore Drive and Lake Michigan, but that was the only good thing I can say about it. The walls of the rooms are paper thin, and you can hear EVERYTHING going on in the adjacent rooms and hallway. Our neighbors were up most of the night living it up with friends, and consequently, so were we! The bathroom was an abomination! There was mildew all over the tub/shower, and in some places you could see it under the caulking--as if they were trying to cover the filth rather than remove it. There were two sconces for lighting over the sink, and I could have written my name in the filth on them. Overall, the bathroom just smelled musty and of mildew, and I felt the need to bathe again upon returning home just to get the "cooties" off of me. When I mentioned to the front desk staff about the mildew and filth, she cringed and said "Sorry about that". Really? Sorry? How about calling housekeeping and getting them up there to CLEAN the room? I wanted to take photos of how disgusting it was, but forgot until we were on our way home. I wish I would have, because a photo speaks for itself. Hilton Hotels should be ashamed to have let such a beautiful historic hotel fall into such ruin. What a shame. I would never recommend this property to anyone, nor will I ever stay there again. There are far too many nice properties downtown to bother with this one.

Reviews.Title: “The Drake is...well the Drake”
Reviews.Author: Clareinsguy
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Drake while in town for some Kiwanis business. I met a trustee from Kiwanis International. He was spending the weekend. I was born in Chicago but had never stayed at the Drake. Silly me. We sure will be staying there again. Great room on a great floor for Hilton Honors members. Great breakfast buffet. A little pricey but good. Beautiful old hotel. Very well maintained. As with all locations downtown, parking really adds to the cost. $50 for valet, $35 self-park. The servers in the Coq d'Or were overwhelmed and service was slow. The entertainment there was pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: mcclain2nd
Reviews.Content: Saw some reviews which stated that the Drake needed updating on the inside. We thought that its interior went with the charm of the historic hotel. We had a corner room with an excellent view of the lake and were in walking distance of most anything one could want to see there. The breakfast was very nice as well. We found the staff of the hotel accommodating and knowledgeable about the area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the Drake”
Reviews.Author: manktripguy
Reviews.Content: I had a nice stay at the Drake. As a HHonors Gold member, I was upgraded to a larger Drake suite overlooking Lake Michigan. The room had all modern amenities, but older furniture and a smaller bathroom (as expected). The room did have a slightly "musty" smell to it, but nothing that couldn't be tolerated ... just the old charm of a hotel like this. As mentioned in previous reviews, I found most of the staff to be nice, but not overly friendly. Of note, the executive lounge is closed and will reopen sometime in late Februrary. Breakfast coupons are given at check-in for use at the Drake Bros. restaurant (up to $23 off the menu). Also note the hotels bar/lounge is closing for renovations during Februrary. I enjoyed my stay here but will likely stay at the Palmer House Hilton next time.

Reviews.Title: “Wow...what a lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2toots
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 2 nights, wish it could have been longer. To my surprise, I was upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite...the only thing missing was a view of Lake Michigan, but we managed :) My Hilton Honors membership allowed us access to the Executive Lounge, which had a stunning view of Lake Michigan. Breakfast in the lounge offered thier famous 'muselli' along with some wonderful pastries and baked goods, cereals, cheses, lox..too much to mention! The lounge is also open for cocktails (for a fee) and light appetizers. There seemed to be ample seating available and there was a computer there also. Our room was more than spacious. When we opened the door to our room, we were in the foyer, roughly 30 feet long and 12 feet wide. On the right side was our living room with a wet bar....there was no way this could be confused with a 'sitting area', this truly was a living room with full sofa and lounge chairs. The wet bar was a nice surpise and well used! Our bedroom contained an extrememly comfortable huge bed and another sofa. TV's in both rooms. The bathroom reflects the era when the hotel was built... walk in shower, soaking tub, mirrored sink, scale, the toilet seemed odd (especially with the flush handle coming out of the wall) but all worked well. I was thrilled to have such great housekeepers on our floor. They always took time to say hello and asked if we needed anything. They were getting the suite across the hall from us ready and offered a quick peak at the view of Lake Michigan...nice view, but our room had a seperate bedroom....then...one of them said...."go down to the end of the hall in about a half hour, we're getting another suite ready and winked." Turns out they were cleaning the "Lady Dianna" suite......and.....I got a sneak peak at that too!!!! There are so many surprises this hotel holds. The evelators have benches...never saw that before! Oh my gosh, our room had a doorbell! We left something in our car and asked if we could get it out..turned out it is a 5 minute walk to the garage. So, when you choose valet parking, please know your car is not being parked in the garage next to the hotel, but down the street...the valets were great and deserve any appreciation you can give them. The Drake is one of those hotels that will remain in my thoughts as one I can not wait to go back too. Yes, having a suite was lovely, but I would not mind having a standard room as well. Thank you to all who made our short stay so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “The room was dirty, smelled bad, service lacking, location good”
Reviews.Author: bosmom
Reviews.Content: This was a surprising experience, surprisingly bad that is. I was thrilled to book the Drake at a very affordable rate through Expedia. I had heard the hotel was the classic grande dame of downtown Chicago. Maybe it once was but that is over. The only sense of a proud history is when you walk into the lobby and up the stairs it's a beautiful entrance. But once you're inside it's downhill from there. The front desk personnel offered the minimum in customer service. They did their job but were not welcoming. They were rather arrogant actually and after staying there I can't imagine why. When I got to my room it smelled so strongly of cleaning chemicals I immediately had to prop open the door to the hall. This didn't help. I found the maids at the end of the long hall and they tried to tell me it didn't smell. Finally one of them said, 'well they told us to hurry with that room.' This seemed to acknowledge there was a problem but they didn't offer to help. Normally I would ask for another room but my friend's room was the same. The chemical smell was not as strong but the room smelled bad and was dirty. I would have checked out immediately but I had a non refundable package and I couldn't afford to. The thing about the dirt here is that it is long accumulated. There isn't visible dust for example, but there's a deeper level of dirt that is like a film over everything. Finally -- and I honestly kid you not -- I started wiping things down with a hot washcloth. We were staying for three nights and I had to do something. The results were incredible, as in the rag was filthy. I kept trying other parts of the room and every part of the room was the same. To make a long and dreary story short, I cleaned for two hours and the smell lifted. I started with the desk, nightstand, phone, remote and went as far as the bathroom floor, even as much of the walls as I could reach. The colors that came up were not just brown and black but orange and yellow. It was jaw dropping. I probably ruined many of the towels and washcloths but maybe they'll get the message. I asked them not to use chemicals in cleaning the room for the rest of my stay. They acted like this was a crazy request and I had to plead chemical sensitivity and allergies (not true) to get them to take me seriously. Except for one morning they complied with my request. There is a wonderful view of the water from the hotel but it's difficult to enjoy because, surprise, the windows are so dirty. Other issues: the restaurant is rather cavernous. The service was hit or miss. The food was an average hotel buffet for breakfast. Items ran out and were not replenished. The concierge in the lobby was helpful but she was overwhelmed with people needing help. I stood in line and most of the time I gave up. In the basement there's a Chanel and a Georg Jensen store. They were deserted. I doubt anyone who could afford these brands would be staying at this hotel. The Drake experience was pretty much a disaster. If you look at my reviews you'll see that I try hard to be fair, helpful and generous. And, trust me, I'm not a neatnik! But this was a really over-the-top situation. In its current condition, I would never go near the Drake again no matter how cheap the price.

Reviews.Title: “A really upscale hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: rajendrarao
Reviews.Content: The hotel is immaculate, and has a terrific history dating back 80 years. The elevators still have sofa seats in them. White glove service through out the hotel. Towels, beddings and furnishings are on par with Trump Hotel, Ritz and Four Seasons. Great location right beside the Water Tower place, and our favorite Ghiradelli's store.

Reviews.Title: “Stranded in Chicago.....Much better than sleeping in airport”
Reviews.Author: johnnyb510
Reviews.Content: Coming from New Orleans, changing planes inChicago..the connecting flight canceled because of snow in NY...So I get a room at the only hotel I know of, The Drake. It was suprisingly affordable and deserves a 5 star rating. Great location etc.etc...food, bar. beds, room, really nice.

Reviews.Title: “not as classy as it used to be”
Reviews.Author: betDublin
Reviews.Content: stayed in the drake on recommendation of my father, big mistake! it has changed SO much in 10 years. the lobby area is very impressive but a little on the run down side. the rooms are a huge let down. We had to practically beg for our parents to be moved from the 1st floor, which overlooked a dirty flat inner roof. eventually they moved them to a 3rd floor smaller room. If it was for 1 night, we wouldnt have cared so much, but we were staying for 5 nights! The location is fantastic & the staff in general were nice, but not going out of thier way to welcome you. The door men were the most helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Luxury, friendliest concierge service......more to be done with front desk”
Reviews.Author: SagaLEB
Reviews.Content: I satyed in The Drake while on a tourism stop in chicago in October 2010. One of the most striking features of the hotel is the friendliness of the supporting staff. I ordered an airport pick up from O'Hare, the driver is nothing short but of the best person you can rely on for a tour of Chicago. He gave me all the deatils I require, all the directives, warned me of the wether changes with accurate precsion. Nothing but great quality information, exactly what you would be require for a short visit. The Concierge service was to die for. I met the three concierges who work in the hotel. Those people deserve their weight in gold. They were extremely helpful, offering me tips and tricks to go along in chicago. They expleined as much as I required. Were so smiley and welcoming. The hotel itself is in a marvelous location. On the maginificent mile, it is close to all landmarks of Chicago. Shopping lovers you are in for a treat as all big shops are just a 5 minutes walk away. the hotel itself was visited by celebrities from all over the world. It is marvelously decorated to keep its antique signature in a great luxurious perspective I just noticed three weak points which one should include in a review: 1- The Front desk personel tend to be cold. It is very cold in Chicago, no ned to be treated coldly especially when there are many other choices in the city for more ffordable prices. I 2- I was surprised to see that one of the coffe cups was used. This was noticed on the first day of check in. I did not report it. Strangely it was not changed throughout my stay. 3- This is 2011, internet is the means of communication. I strongly believe that a hotel without free internet connecton or at least a nominal cheap connection fee is not business nor tourism friendly. While The Drake scores high on my review, it could have scored top score if internet was provided free in rooms or at least in some areas of the facility. It is still a recommendation

Reviews.Title: “Absolute heaven...we were treated like royalty!”
Reviews.Author: mrudolph79
Reviews.Content: From start to finish, our stay was perfect! We were celebrating our 30th anniversary and it was wonderful. Service was excellent, from front desk, to room service, to dining in the Cape Cod (mmmm!)...everyone treated us like VIPs! Our room was just beautiful, the decor and view were second to none. I would recommend this elegant, iconic hotel to anyone visiting Chicago...can't say enough about how great our stay was. Special thanks to the general manager who saw to it that our anniversary was so memorable...assigned us a beautiful suite and even had a special "Happy Anniversary" cake sent up...we are so grateful for the special attention given us! The Drake is #1!

Reviews.Title: “Sense of History & Style”
Reviews.Author: revenueguru
Reviews.Content: For the first time in my life I was able to stay at The Drake Hotel in Chicago. The location of this hotel is unbeatable. See my photos for the view of Lakeshore drive from my room. Furthermore it is right off North Michigan avenue by all the malls. The hotel has so much history it's unbelievable. The desk clerk told us that President Obama was there the week before we arrived. They have a window display that shows some of the signatures of historical figures that have stayed there. Don't miss the Princess Grace signature, or Dean Martin. Loved the bed treatments. Bathrooms were very roomy and cleanliness in this property is top-notch. One other tip, I bought my room directly on their website and saved substantially over Expedia.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service at The Drake”
Reviews.Author: ksp93
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Drake for two nights Thanksgiving weekend. The hotel is a beautiful older hotel that has been maintained very well. Our King lakeview room was nice, but nothing special (for price) - great view, large bath, comfy bed. What sets this hotel apart from others is the service. All of the staff went above and beyond welcoming you and taking care of you. They would actually take the time to visit with you and tell stories that were fun to listen to. Anything you needed was there within minutes - whether a bath robe or a drink! The floral shop at the hotel is beautiful with lots of great gifts. All of the restaurants and bars were fun, and again great service. It was a wonderful place to stay during the holidays.

Reviews.Title: “Experience”
Reviews.Author: PREZSY
Reviews.Content: The hotel is old, and it desperately needs rennovation. The temperate is unstable, and it smells. The floor squeaks. The bar is frequented by folks who are in their 60s and 70s. A couple of chairs are broken. It took us 20-30 minutes to get the car from the velet and it cost $50 plus tips. When we arrived around midnight, there was no bell boy. We ended up carry all luggages by ourselves. Please note that you would need to walk up a few stars (about 20 steps) to get to the elevator. It is not fun if you are not physically fit and have quite a few luggage. Service is OK. The good thing is that the rooms are relatively good size, and the hotel has a history. However, in light of other newer and better hotels, Drake does not worth what the room rate is. Therefore, when the whole city is sold out, you can always find rooms at the Drake.

Reviews.Title: “The service, location, and accommodations were amazing”
Reviews.Author: rlaurak
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is very convenient - on the edge of the magnificent mile. I booked through priceline for 2 people - my sister and I. The day before the trip my other sister decided to join... When I arrived at the front desk I explained this and it looked like they couldn't accommodate the extra person without adding another 30$ to our stay each night for a cot. Anyway - the worker was so great, she found us a room with a pull out couch and a queen bed (2 TVs!). Although it was on the 1st floor, so the view was non-existent, everything else about the room was fantastic. It was the first hotel, in a long time, where I had no issues at all with the restocking and cleaning of the room. I'd highly recommend the drake, it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Would Definitely Recommend to Anyone!”
Reviews.Author: awilliamson22
Reviews.Content: My husband suprised me for my birthday with a trip to Chicago (it was our first trip to the city), and he got a great deal at The Drake. We didn't know what to expect since it was an older, historic hotel but he contacted the management and let them know it was a special occasion. We were treated like royalty - someone called to check on us when our flight arrived in the city, our room was fantastic with a great view of Lake Michigan, and they even surprised me by delivering a cake to our room for my birthday! The location was perfect - we could walk just about anywhere we wanted to go - great shopping on the Magnificent Mile, restaurants, Architectural Boat Tour, etc. I would highly recommend the Drake and plan to stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Very charming, but mistook service for hospitality and privacy...”
Reviews.Author: joshuaray4
Reviews.Content: Located at the end of the Magnificent Mile, the location for this historic hotel couldn't be any better. Every shopping, dining experience, or tourist attraction was all within walking distance (and a pleasant walk it was!). The rooms are furnished with elegant furniture and feature lots of original (or close replicas) hardware on the doors, toilet, lights, etc. This, however, is what made part of this experience quite unejoyable... The walls and doors are paper thin because they're (as far as I could tell) quite orginal. I could hear every conversation in the hall from my bed, got to know personal (ahem)business my neighbors were involved in, and couldn't talk above a low murmur without worry everyone else in the hotel could hear me as well. This made sleep uncomfortable and caused me to be awake as much as I was asleep on one night in particular. Additionally, while every member of the hotel staff greeted you and made contact as you passed, they were very uninviting. This isn't reserved to the custodial staff that you'd normall expect to be quiet, but every other group in the hotel you'd expect to be more hospitable. Don't mistake what I'm saying... VERY service minded, but VERY unfriendly. If you're not looking to make nice or expect others to at least pretend to be nice back, this won't bother you. However, as a southerner, this is completely opposite to what I'm used to. Finally, my opening comment was regarding the perfect location... this is ONLY true if using public transportation or walking. If you have to leave the downtown area, GOOD LUCK. This city system is so screwed up, there's bumper to bumper traffic across all 5+ lanes going each direction around the downtown area from about 14:00-18:00. This makes getting back to downtown from any of the surrounding burbs a miserable (and very slow) experience. Chicago was a nice city, but I'm in no hurry to go back. If I do head back that way, I'll find another hotel in the relative location that hasn't forgotten that (in my opinion) hospitality goes SO much further than just being subserviant.

Reviews.Title: “We were treated like royalty during our stay at The Drake!”
Reviews.Author: RallySport
Reviews.Content: We were in Chicago for a family wedding. The reception was held at The Drake, so we decided to book our stay there as well. Every single employee treated us as if we were the most important people there! The hotel manager surprised and delighted us by having a delicious chocolate cake delivered to our room for my husband's upcoming birthday. Our room was quiet, comfortable and overlooked Lake Michigan. Afternoon tea was a nice change of pace for us. Our entire experience at The Drake was happily memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Room Way Below Expectations”
Reviews.Author: steve50207
Reviews.Content: The quality of the furnishings was way below what we expected from a 4 star hotel - the woodwork looked like it had not been maintained in 20 years. We would have been disappointed if the room had been 1/2 of the $250/nite cost.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: brejohns
Reviews.Content: The location is great, at the beginning of the Miracle Mile. The rooms are very nice, and the beds are very comfortable. The bathrooms are old, so there is not much room for you and your spouse to use it at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: DHPColumbia_SC
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel to hold corporate meetings. Was very surprised to have Internet charges additional to room rate. Great location. Very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “nice but overrated”
Reviews.Author: MARAtlanta
Reviews.Content: overall, for the money I would rather stay at The Conrad

Reviews.Title: “Drake - Fantastic Service and Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: windycitty
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Drake for four nights from Sept 26-30 with my wife and we had a simply great holiday. To start with this is the first review for a hotel we have submitted and we have stayed at many hotels in the downtown Chicago area over the last 7-8years. Our Trip Advisor basics are we discount any comments from a couple on their honeymoon (if you had a bad honeymoon itâ€™s not the hotels fault!). A sincere but brief email to the Drake hotels manager and general manager was the start of a fantastic stay, the two gentlemen Stefan and Russell both took the time to email us back and took a genuine interest in our upcoming stay. In fact they gave us their cell numbers if we needed anything looked after prior to arriving at the Drake. To take the time and make the offer of contacting them by cell in the middle of running the hotel and the conferences that were at the hotel was I thought superior service. We received an room upgrade to a executive suite and unlike many other hotels the executive suite actually lived up to its nameâ€¦ door bell to the room, full kitchen (full sized fridge, cupboards, sink), 2 bathrooms, two king size beds, two t.v.s, full dining room, about 8 full size windows overlooking the lake and beachâ€¦wow, we paced it off and the suite was about 40ft by 45ft! It was my wifeâ€™s birthday (a significant number) and our anniversary around the time of our stay and they sent up a chocolate cake and chilled champagne upon about an hour after we checked in, again great service. I wanted to leave a review after reading some of the reviews in the recent several months. In summary the hotel is elegant, a bit sophisticated and yes, is not really trendy but I would take the classic style of the Drake and itâ€™s timeless feel over a hotel that thinks chic is changing the paint colour and lamp shades every year for the latest trend. An example of this is the Cqd Dâ€™or Lounge on the ground floor, it is such a classic â€œold schoolâ€� Lounge, wood/leather everything, a bit cramped and service from a real bar tender and not a barely of age kid as in so many establishmentsâ€¦note this is not a sports bar it is a true Lounge. As stated so many times, the Drake is in a great location close to everything including public transit. Our tips from this trip, take in the Wrigley Field baseball park tour, see a Sox game in the south side, buy the transit pass (a great deal) and check out the Chicago Botanic Gardens about a 45min ride from the downtown on the regional transit system. The Drake was great and provided us with a great time and even better memories.

Reviews.Title: “Dowager Hotel With Warts”
Reviews.Author: Brian_NVA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great place to stay if you're into old hotels with ornate decorations, lots of history, and famous former guests (most notably Queen Elizabeth decades ago). It's also in a great location - about a block from the John Hancock Tower, three or four blocks away from the lakefront "beach", and about a 20 minute walk to Navy Pier. This hotel is not a great place to stay if you want things to work right. Some examples: (1) There are large flat screen TVs in the rooms (really too large for the smaller rooms, in my opinion), and a note that says "We are currently upgrading our cable television service to High Definition, which has changed some of our channeling." However, my picture was fuzzy and clearly not High Def, so I called downstairs and they sent up an engineer. He was very nice and apologetic, but the bottom line is they probably won't be switching to High Def until this winter sometime. He fiddled around with the connections, but the picture didn't really get any better. (2) I switched to a larger room on the second day (more on that later), where the Internet connector was broken and I couldn't get the heat to work. I called downstairs for both problems and they sent up a different engineer - also very pleasant and competent - who replaced the Internet cord, and told me the building's heat was not yet turned on... so he left me a six foot space heater. (3) The phone beside the bed was dead. (4) The TV remote control was worn out... no numbers on the channel buttons and the on/off switch required a very hard push just inches away from the screen. I didn't call downstairs for these last two. (5) TV service was out one night in the whole hotel (the front desk said it was an area outage), so we were told we could watch a movie free of charge. Unfortunately, and surprisingly to me, most movies were "sold out" because of the large number of people accepting the offer. Bottom line... quite a few things didn't work right in the room (bad), but the hotel acted quickly to try and make them right when notified (good). I would just prefer to have them right before I check in. Service was a bit of a mixed bag. I didn't get a requested complementary room upgrade when I checked in, even though we found out the next day it was available and should have been given to me... so I ended up changing rooms the second day (which was a pain in the neck). Room service for dinner, which was quite expensive, brought me the wrong dessert and forgot my fries, both on the same night... but corrected both problems. The In-Room Dining menu is pretty limited. I found the Guest Services number and Operator to be staffed by some folks who could use customer service training - they were quite abrupt at times. Other staff such as housekeeping went out of their way to be very friendly and hospitable. The concierge was helpful. They have an awesome breakfast buffet, with lots of hot food including omelets made to order. However, it's very expensive ($23) if it doesn't come with your room rate. I think I'll try somewhere else next time. The ambience of a dowager hotel isn't worth the hassle and inconvenience of getting things corrected.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and service from a legendary hotel”
Reviews.Author: younc024
Reviews.Content: Just spend the last 4 days at the Drake attending meetings- some of which were also at the Drake. I had never stayed there before I had only knew the Drake by reputation. I have to say I loved this hotel. It's classic in every respect. I loved the room, the service was excellent- it was like stepping back into old Chicago- with historical references through out the hotel. This is one of the times where the hotel lived up to its reputation.

Reviews.Title: “Seen Beter Days”
Reviews.Author: cgall9
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Drake with my wife and kids. Have been going to Chicago for years and this is my fourth stay at the Drake and my last. The hotel is old and has seen better days. The service is nothing out of the ordinary and YOU HAVE TO PAY A FEE TO USE THE INTERNET. A fee for internet in your room and a fee for going to the business center to use it..ABSURD! At least you can go to the coffee house leasing space on the first floor and use theirs. WAKE UP DRAKE! FREE INTERNET AT MCDONALDS AND NOT WHEN YOU SPEND TWO HUNDRED ON A HOTEL ROOM?? Not going back due to the nickle diming of the guests.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: MariaGGG
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Drake for a conference and had to have a whole bunch of boxes come in and out, and had a set of other associated special requests. Drake's staff was amazing in handling all the things. The business center staffer's help with shipping is the only reason why I made my flight today. Amazing service, cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Moondancers01
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel a wonderful place to stay . It was close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Worth paying extra for the superlative view”
Reviews.Author: notacouchpotato
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Drake, booked into an Executive room which had access to the executive lounge. The best thing about the room was the view down onto the 'beach' and Lakeshore Drive - just wonderful and worth the modest amount of extra money. The lounge provided fruit/canapes/beverages for breakfast/aperitifs and was quiet with same lovely view. The room itself was large and the bed extremely comfortable - big bathroom with usual welcome toiletries. Very helpful concierge. We used the Coq d'Or bar and grill once for a meal and several times for pre-dinner drinks and the service was always swift and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “The Drake; a mistake?”
Reviews.Author: 2Travelers2go
Reviews.Content: There is no other Chicago hotel like The Drake - it is a classic. Beautiful building, elegance all around. We have been prior guests and were so looking forward to this visit for a couple of nights. But - be warned -- there are problems with their web-based reservation system - and the front desk staff. You may not get what you thought you booked and paid for. We selected a category that was junior suite, lake front view. I even had the print-out that stated this description along with the rest of the reservation. When we got to the front desk the clerk said it was NOT a lake front we would be getting, but a "city view" When I protested, and showed the print-out as proof, she could have cared less. Ms. Frosty at the front desk was hearing none of it and was completely nonplussed to the point of rudeness and adamantly insisted the hotel was full and they could do nothing for us. Nonsense. It was a weekend. Later later on, one of the bartenders told us the hotel was at 47 percent. When we arrived in our room, the "city view" was of the air conditioning units on the roof. Nice. Especially since we paid the hotel's rate - thought that by booking direct we might have a bit of consideration over others who use generic multi-booking hotel sites. Not at The Drake. The more I thought about it, the more upset I became and I called the manager later. No real interest or apology from him, either. Considering we had stayed at The Drake before, I was not impressed with his response. The room itself was fine - clean spacious and everything worked properly but the view of air conditioning units was a complete let-down. I am afraid that the current crop of employees have brought a new millenium attitude - which is we don't give a care about the guests - even repeat guests. What a shame since the cornerstone of The Drake'slegacy is built on service! So I guess we won't be repeats any more - especially with all the new hotels available in Chicago.
