We would probably go back to The Drake to have a drink in one of their bars - the service and ambiance there was awesome. But doubtful we will stay again. On a plus note, the new Lavazza cafe on-site is a wonderful place to get a coffee and snack.

Reviews.Title: “Gone Downhill, Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: gjneumann
Reviews.Content: Went ahead and got the executive suites because I wanted no hassles! Obviously, the bean-counters have cut huge cost out of this place and put the money in thier pocket. ie -Trying to charge extra for services that should be free (charged 39$ for continetal breakfast for me and my wife when it's supposed to be free). PS. the breakfast was nothing special -Room was to be ready at 3PM. We had to wait until 6:30PM. Then tried to charge extra by holding our luggage for our 3-1/2 hours wait. -Shower was not working properly. -Hotel is noisy. -No soap in bathroom. -And when asked at checkout if everything is OK, we said no. Then they rudely asked what's wrong. They found none of my abovementioned items to be complaint worthy and still charged us 339 dollars for a one night rotten stay! The Drake is exploiting their past reputation to make short term gains. They are truly Crooks! I would not recommend it to friends. And oh, by the way, this is my first complaint ever on a hotel (I stay in ~ 40 hotels yearly).

Reviews.Title: “Great ambiance but so so rooms”
Reviews.Author: agirlnamedlou
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel but their 4 star rating is not warranted for regular rooms. Ours had mold in the tub and on the shower curtain. The drain was clogged. They fixed the drain promptly but the shower curtain took a day to change. We paid about 200 a night but it included breakfast at Drake Bros.. The room had a good view. There were only a handful of cable channels and internet cost $17. per night. Breakfast at the Drake Brothers costs $25 for the buffet and it was nothing special. A bit of a rip off. It reminded me of a lower quality Vegas buffet. My son got cereal and it cost $9 plus tip $11. I don't mind paying if I get my money's worth and the food wasn't worth it. Why is it that the cheap hotels include breakfast, free phone calls, free exercise room, and free internet but the higher priced hotels charge for every little thing plus you have to tip everyone. All my life I have wanted to stay at the Drake and it was a bit of a let down. The room was old and dirty. I am not sure if I would stay there again or not. I also stayed at the Seneca a few blocks away which was a bit cheaper but not as elegant. Last year I stayed at the Amalfi. I would chose the Amalfi over the Drake.

Reviews.Title: “Location is amazing, but hotel could use some updates”
Reviews.Author: CPMW
Reviews.Content: The Drake is a classic and I definitely recommend, but the hotel really needs some updating. There was no free internet, bed was lumpy, air conditioner was loud in the room, TV was awful in the room, refrigerator was not cold in the room. Service was good. Location is absolutely amazing. We got the lakefront room and the view of Lake Michigan is great.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed Big Time”
Reviews.Author: Pgillxl
Reviews.Content: We were their for a wedding ,paid top dollars for a smelly old room with spiders hanging from the ceiling,bath rooms need major renovations.What a Rip off? We will never go back.Stay away.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic staff and a grand hotel”
Reviews.Author: explore with more
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at The Drake Hotel while in Chicago for a wedding. The Drake Hotel is truly one of the few remaining grand hotels - elegant and gracious in every way. All the staff were wonderful during the wedding weekend - very courteous, accomodating, knowledgeable. Some of the best hotel staff I've encountered in a long time. The room was large and had a great view of Lake Michigan. I recommend upgrading to a room with a lake view if possible. As this is an older hotel, the rooms were not filled wtih lots of hi-tech amenities, but I was grateful for this. The room was clean and spacious and quiet and the huge king bed was very comfortable. The bathroom could benefit from a bit of updating, in particular the tub, but this is a minor issue. There are several restaurants in the hotel, all of which look excellent, but we only had breakfast in the hotel. Breakfast is served in the Drake Bros room. The buffet was a bit pricey, but it was one of the best and most bountiful breakfast buffets I've ever had. The one critque of the hotel concerns internet access. If you use the small business center to check e-mails, etc, you have to pay $6 for 15 minutes. This is excessive. I regretted not bringing my own lap top and hence having to rely on the hotel's computers. But overall, The Drake is an outstanding, elegant hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Security issue”
Reviews.Author: BCM10
Reviews.Content: We were in Chicago recently and stayed at the Drake Hotel. We had a 17-year-old exchange student with us who had left some money ($60-80) in the room for fear of having all of her money pick pocketed on the streets of Chicago. I advised her to take her money with her; instead, she did what her parents had told her and left some of her money in the room, unbeknownst to meâ€¦until it was too late. We got back to the room, and sure enough, her wallet and money were gone. A delivery of a rollaway bed was made to the room during the 3 Â½ hours while we were out. We reported the incident to hotel security and tried to get some satisfaction from either the Drake or their insurance company. No apologies were given until I had asked for one, and there were no offers of compensation. Additionally, I had to initiate communications to find out what, if anything, the hotel was doing to follow up. I am not surprised that this sort of incident happened in a big city, but I am disappointed that a top rated hotel like the Drake didnâ€™t make some gesture to appease us. Certainly, we would have liked the money back. But ,if they were not willing to do that without some evidence of a theft, I hoped they would have at least offered a meal, or free parking, something to make the situation right. If they had made some gesture, we would have thought the Drake management was trying to be fair. Instead, they washed their hands of the ugly incident and passed it off to their insurance company who quickly denied any claims. We can recover from the loss of money. However, the frustration and disappointment in the Drake over this incident I will never forget.

Reviews.Title: “An elegant Grand Dame Chicago Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Basebirds
Reviews.Content: The Drake does not disappoint. I have long wanted to say "I'm staying at The Drake" and finally got the chance. We did a "staycation" this year and spent a few days in the city. I booked through Priceline and was tickled that my bid was accepted by none other than The Drake. Upon arrival, however, I learned that a "queen room" at The Drake includes ONE queen bed, not two. So for our family of five, we had a total of 2 beds in the two rooms I booked. The manager came to assist and said something about "when you book through Priceline....." and I got ready to be treated badly because I hadn't booked through the hotel nor did I pay full price, I couldn't have been more wrong. The manager, Tom, bent over backwards to accommodate us and we had two absolutely lovely rooms. The hotel is old, but is so elegantly beautiful that felt like I was living back in the 40's. The staff is old-world style friendly and gracious. Tea is still served every afternoon and shouldn't be missed. An experience like this you don't find everywhere in this day and age. But because of it's location, be prepared for the $49 per night fee to park your car! Ouch! Please don't miss The Drake!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel. Perfect location. Walk...”
Reviews.Author: GinaDoo
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. Perfect location. Walk out the front door and you are on the Miracle Mile and out the back door to Lake Michigan and the beach. Staff is very attentive to making your stay special. This classic hotel has a wonderful energy about it. You won't be disappointed. Get a room with a lake view.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed experience”
Reviews.Author: wombatwi
Reviews.Content: Hotel from outside and common areas/lobby superb; rooms were somewhat dissapointing though, smallish, small bathrooms. Everything was clean, but old, so there is need for some major renovation in order to compete with the rroms of Sofitel, Westin, grand Hyatt eg. which offer far more room quality for a better price. Looks like you have to pay a lot just for the "tradition". View of the room over the lake was nice though. Staff did a good job. All in all you get the same quality as in the Knickerbocker on the other side of the street for a higher price.

Reviews.Title: “Old - there are many better properties in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: rcmax29
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very old and seems to be a bit too tied to its past rather than concerned with the present. Mechanical systems leave a lot to be desired - the air conditioning just cannot keep up with Chicago summers. As one reviewer said, who cares if Queen Elizabeth stayed here 50 years ago if your air conditioner doesn't work?? A huge percentage of the rooms have virtually no view - unless you like looking out on the huge but ineffective air conditioning compressors. There a just too many great hotels throughout the River North - Miracle Mile area to waste a trip in this tired old property - hotels with great views from nearly every room, new mechanical systems, better location (the Drake is on the very end of the Miracle Mile, not all that convenient to most shopping, eating, and even State Street Red Line subway stops. The two-bathroom double queen is a great innovation and about the only reason a family would want to stay here, but you will give up any hope for a view. Also, the much touted Cape Cod room seemed like a morgue. There must be a reason it sat over half empty when restaurants offering similar fare deal with overflow crowds. Speaking of which, try Joe's Seafood a few blocks to the south -great food and service! Ditto for Harry Caray's. For a disounted rate, the Drake would be fine, and this is NOT a bad hotel. But once you get up in the $250-350 range, there are simply some great hotels up and down Michigan Avenue that are among some of the best in the country - don't settle for the Drake if you don't have to.

Reviews.Title: “The Drake reminds us that a great hotel is much more than a building with great rooms”
Reviews.Author: Solange72
Reviews.Content: After experiencing many Chicago hotels, almost all rated more highly on tripadvisor than the Drake (Sofitel, all the Westins, Sheratons, Ws, Hampton, Sax and many more). Starting with the minimum criterion of a good room which matters when I travel with some or all of my kids: the family room (one king bed/one sofa bed) is absolutely lovely: spacious, great bedding, great sofa -with all the needed sheets/blankets/pillows-, five large windows on the street spectacle and even a sliver of lake Michigan, wonderful curtains to actually block off the light of early morning, great bathroom. Now, here is the special part: first it has taken me years to make my way to the Drake (because of relatively poor tripadvisor ratings!!) eventhough I've wanted to try the high tea at the Palm court , to experience proximity to the beach and to stay in this landmark hotel with a wealth of history) and....we are here not a moment too soon. It is the anticipation of needs which sets the Drake way above the other hotels I have mentioned: at check in, all around the room, when changing any aspects of reservation, enquiring about anything: the employees appear to have a level of skill that is noticeably better than the employees (even well meaning ones) at other hotels. This will be where we try to stay when in Chicago from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Still a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: beach bum in ohio
Reviews.Content: We stayed here July 16-18. Though it's an older hotel, the Drake has been renovated and kept up very well. It still has that charm of an older, exclusive hotel, but the rooms are big and have new furnishings (including flat screen tvs). We stayed in a king room and the bedding was very comfortable. We didn't use WiFi but were told it was available in our room on the 5th floor. The hotel is a totally non-smoking hotel. The lobby is smaller than most lobbies these days but is very beautiful. Just a few steps up from the lobby is the Palm Court, which is where they serve afternoon tea and seemed to have some sort of music (piano, harpist, etc). There's a also a full bar in that area. Located at the top of N. Michigan Ave., the Drake is directly across the street from Bloomingdales and the other shops on Michigan are nearby. The Hancock building is a block away and the Water Tower Place mall is 2 blocks away. Overall, the service was great. We had plenty of towels, check in was quick and easy, check out can be done by phone from your room. Taxis are always available right outside the front door. The El station is a few blocks away on Chicago Ave. I highly recommend this hotel. On the next block over, we ate at The Grill and Cafe Med, both of which were casual but had great, upscale food and a nice wine list. Both also had sidewalk seating. We came across the restaurant Feast, which was also good, but the service was a bit slow. If nightlife is your thing, the Wit hotel near the loop has a great rooftop bar called Roof. Very trendy with fire pits and a great view of the city. The crowd was all ages who were dressed in everything from shorts and t-shirts to summer dresses. Of course, if you want Chicago deep dish pizza, check out Giordano's. It's nearby on Rush.

Reviews.Title: “You Need to Upgrade to get a Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: AvalonDive
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Drake twice, and we really love it. The secret, however, is that you really need to upgrade to get a nice room. We've always upgraded, but we've had friends who have stayed in the standard rooms, and they say it's like staying in a closet with a view of the fire escape - if that. (I think a lot of "upscale" hotels are like this. The standard rooms are worse than a Holiday Inn, but the nicer rooms are spectacular.) The first time we stayed at the Drake, we requested a lake view room, and it had the most spectacular views!! The room was huge and had a little sitting area. The bathroom was small, but the size of the main room more than made up for it. On this trip, I was ill and had to spend a lot of time in the room, so the views were very important to me. I also ordered a lot of room service, and I have to say the food was excellent. The second time we stayed there, we requested an Executive Room on a high floor. We were on the 9th floor with a view overlooking the front entrance. Since Chicago is a city with tall skyscrapers, a "city view" is really just a view of the skyscraper across the street. It was still a very pretty view, and sure, it's entertaining to watch the people in the windows across the way, but I think the Lake View rooms are far better. In any case, our "city view" room was beautiful. It was smaller than the first "lake view" room, but we really loved the Executive Lounge, which is worth the price of the upgrade because you are provided with free buffet breakfast daily, free drinks and appetizers in the evening (alcohol for a small reasonable fee), free cans of soft drinks any time, and free computer usage. It also has that gorgeous view of the lake that our room was lacking. The beds were the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in. In fact, after our first trip I went on a hunt to find out who makes the beds so that we could buy one. The lobby is beautiful and worth a walk through even if you don't stay here. We enjoyed the bar downstairs, which sometimes was so crowded you couldn't walk through and at other times was nearly empty. The location is very good. You can walk the Magnificent Mile fairly easily, and you are close to wonderful restaurants. I took the bus to the Art Institute and the Museum of Natural History, but taxis are readily available outside the hotel. I know we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel sleep I have ever had”
Reviews.Author: raura
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night. Checked in with an Hhonors booking, and upgraded from basic room to the next one up. Fantastic views of the beach/lake. Valet parking superb ($49), bell boy, concierge all excellent. Rooms are simply breath taking. Amazing marble bath rooms, gigantic bed, great TV. Mini bar expensive but that is to be expected. Lavazza coffee for free in the room. The bed was simply magical, and was so comfortable. I had the best sleepthat I have ever had in a hotel room. Plenty of TV channels, and they advise that they are now upgrading all rooms to High Definition TV. Great coffee shop just out the front door and to the right that serves amazing Lavazza coffee (best I have had in the US). Location is awesome, close to Michigan Ave for shopping, and 20 minute walk to Navy pier. Right next to John Hancock building. The only disappointment was no free Wifi in the room (but there was in the lobby).

Reviews.Title: “Dont be fooled into staying here if you are booking a Standard Room only. You will be treated differently!”
Reviews.Author: sng622
Reviews.Content: I want to first off say that I am not a fussy travellor. I have stayed around the world in all types of hotels, from 2 stars to 5 stars. I was very vigilent in reading Tripadvisor and other reviews on other sites before booking with the Drake. There were many poor reviews, but I chalked them up to be fussy people. The NEGATIVE REVIEWS ARE NOT EXAGGERATED! Now, the Drake is not a horrible hotel by any means. The lobby is very beautiful, and Im sure that people who book the big expensive suites are treated wonderfully, but do not be pulled in by the allure of it being a "high class" or a landmark hotel if you are staying in a standard room. I booked our 3 night stay via an internet booking site. This was a spur of the moment getaway to celebrate with my boyfriend. We were celebrating both of our birthdays as well as his graduation from Medical School with distinction. Needless to say, this was a very big occasion for us both. After reading tripadvisor, I saw that the General manager, Russell Menkes reads these reviews, and offers explanations for unhappy guests and his contact info. So I decided to email Mr. Menkes, telling him I had booked via Travelocity and to ask him if he would be able to assist me in reserving a room with a view or on a higher floor, or if the Drake provides anything for celebrations. I emailed him over weeks before our travel date and he has yet to respond to me. I feel that this is very unprofessional. Even if he were to answer me to say that they were unable to accomodate my request, it is better than not answering me at all. After getting no response from Mr. Menkes, I emailed the general reception desk regarding the same matter, where I received a response riddled with grammar and spelling errors (which is no crime, but again reinforced the feeling of unprofessionalism), informing me that the room I have been assigned is not known for its view, and if I wanted a view, it would cost XX dollars more per night, and this offer would expire in 24 hours. I thought that perhaps they were offering me a special "discounted" rate to get a room with a view, however, I checked on Travelocity and I could have easily upgraded to a room with a view for much LESS than what I was quoted. I didnt like that very much. I responded by saying, no I would not like to upgrade my room, however, it would be appreciated if they could place us on a higher floor if possible, view or no view. I received no response to that email. They did not place me on a higher floor. When arriving at the hotel, check-in was a breeze. very fast and efficient. However, once getting to the room, I could see that they had placed us in what must have been one of their worst rooms in the hotel. The room's air conditioning unit was SO incredibly loud. It clicked and clanked ALL night. and every time it turned on, the noise was equiv to the sound of a small hand held vacuum cleaner. It woke both me and my boyfriend up several times during the night. Furthermore, it was not very powerful. We happened to stay there during the extreme heatwave, and it would have been nice to have an air con unit that didnt produce musty air. The wall paper was bubbling and peeling off the wall in a very large sections, the wall paper looked a bit dirty and worn. Definitely NOT was I was expecting out of a hotel like the Drake. Ive stayed in motels that are nicer than that. The bathroom, however, was very nice, it was obvious that money had been put into renovations (marble floor, new tiling etc.), HOWEVER, where the carpet meets the marble at the doorway, there was a nail that stuck up underneath the carpet that I inadvertantly stepped on that ripped a big cut on the bottom of my foot! BEWARE, as I read another tripadvisor reviewer said the same thing. The bedding was worn, the skirt of the bed was torn, and the cups in the room were dirty. Now, I have had family members stay at the Drake previously, but in large suites. They had a fantastic time, and the service and room were great for them. However, it is quite apparant that for people who do not stay in their fancy suites, they are not treated the same as their "richer" guests. Overall, I had booked the Drake in hopes of celebrating and living in a luxury hotel for a few days. Instead, I was treated as a second rate guest and shoved into one of the worst hotel rooms Ive ever stayed at in North America. The Drake was a huge disappointment, and you can take the money you spend at the Drake and go to any of the other wonderful hotels on the Mile and be treated much better. It is a shame that the Drake service is so poor, as I know I will be travelling to and from Chicago frequently, and they have definitely lost a customer in me.

Reviews.Title: “One of the World's BEST”
Reviews.Author: Phillytravelwriter
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel quite a few times and I have never been let down. As a matter of fact, on my last trip to Chicago I was upgraded to a suite. The room service was impeccable and I found the front desk staff as well as housekeeping incredibly polite and helpful. People who complain about the front desk being on the phone have clearly never had to actually work customer service. This is something the people at the front desk have to do. You can't go wrong with this hotel. It's one of the classics and you are still treated like royalty.

Reviews.Title: “Back to an era where hotels were glamorous...”
Reviews.Author: tothegypsy
Reviews.Content: The Drake is a throwback to an era where hotels were a place to see and be seen...true glamor! The lobby is grand and elegant, and the public areas are immaculately clean. Check-in was fast, and the concierge (Ron) was so kind to recommend a great dinner spot and obtain a reservation for us. The room was spacious enough with a queen bed, walk-in closet, desk, and flat-screen TV. The hallways were wide and bright - something rarely seen in modern hotels. The lounge is great (albeit pricey) - try the French Martini!

Reviews.Title: “A Near Perfect Business Trip....”
Reviews.Author: djstraveler
Reviews.Content: I got the Drake through Priceline at $90 a night for 3 nights. The location is perfect; at the north end of Michigan Avenue, one block off of the beach; one block from the John Hancock building. Upon arrival, I was greeted warmly by the bellmen at the curb and by the front desk staff. I asked for an upgraded room with a view, and was told they could accommodate my request. The lobby is beautiful and classy. The hallways on each floor are incredibly wide with beautiful carpeting. I got room#423, which looked out onto Michigan Avenue. Whether it was truly an upgrade, I do not know. The room was large, with a 46" flat screen and a king bed. Very nicely appointed; great bedding; nice quiet air conditioning; large closet with a safe; large bathroom. Everything looked great, but the bathroom was showing its age a bit and was a bit dimly lit. Overall, cleanliness was not perfect, but it was acceptable. Very high ceilings helped make the room seem even larger. Great water pressure in the shower - but the bathroom could probably use a renovation to be perfectly honest. Hardwire internet access for $13 a day (although i used my cellular card to avoid the cost). A fully stocked minibar as well. I also used the fitness center on the first floor - absolutely perfect! I ate at Cape Cod in the hotel one night. What a great meal - highly recommended. The host was covering as bartender and he was friendly, but not overbearing and served me great drinks and a perfect meal. I also ate at Rosebud just down the block from the hotel. Another great place with a pretty unique menu for a steakhouse. Mike the bartender is a great guy. I had a couple of pints of Guinness in the hotel bar in the basement...not overly impressive, but it served its purpose. A short walk gets you to the Cheesecake Factory, where you can get a piece of cake to go for a sugar fix. The number of shops, restaurants and bars within a 10 minute walk is truly amazing. Strolling down Michigan Ave is great entertainment, both for shopping and people watching. There's a pretty sizable amount of homeless people and beggars - I must admit the begging became annoying, but times are tough. So, to sum up, is the Drake perfect? No, its not. Its an old hotel that shows some wear and tear, but more than makes up for it with character. And I found every encounter with the staff to be warm and comfortable. The bellmen were helpful; front desk staff perfect; room service staff were great (and even called to make sure I was satisfied); housekeeping was great (Carolyn was so warm and friendly to me and cheered me up when I was feeling a bit lonely); Cap Cod staff was great. Not a snooty or obnoxious person that I encountered. I would recommend a high floor as there is some street noise (Its Chicago). For the price I paid, I was 100% satisfied! PS. Don't bring a car...Its $50 a day to park.

Reviews.Title: “Worst bathroom I've dealt with in a long time”
Reviews.Author: downeysf
Reviews.Content: Snobby, pretentious and undeserving of it's once great reputation. The great location and amazing lobby didnt make it a whole experience to me. I'd like my $260 back. Spiders and assorted bugs in the room. A horrible shower that made me consider stopping by the Y instead

Reviews.Title: “The old dame not what she used to be”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl123z
Reviews.Content: Don't expect the Ritz. don't even expect the Holiday Inn. Yes, the main lobby , the views of the lake and the location of the hotel save it. However, the uncaring desk staff (talking on the phone while a long line developed to check-in) was the first clue this was maybe not going to be the special weekend I hoped. It got worse when the room that we had was not the spacious room we thought we were getting...instead it was small with two small windows looking out at the lake. One of the windows had a view of the neighbors room. The airconditioner took a long time to work, there was mold on the shower curtain liner, a light was burnt out and the phone messaging didn't work. One xxxxx-large robe no one could wear. The room was said to be renovated but that meant some new linens, a new rug and a new countertop in the very small bathroom. The furnishings were old and the lamp shades had enough dust on it to be from 1920. The lack of staff attention, housekeeping and the quality of the room was the most disappointing. I would read the bad reviews next time and stay somewhere else. I could write many other comments that made me very upset and sad at the lack of attention and thought this hotel has for their guests.

Reviews.Title: “No Longer Fit For a Queen”
Reviews.Author: ridgelift
Reviews.Content: The Drake Hotel boasts of all the royalty that has graced its halls over the years. And while I don't doubt that the Queen of England stayed at the Drake, she certainly didn't stay in my room. Let me back up. There is much to recommend the Drake. The location right off of the Miraculous Mile (world-class shopping) and across from Lake Michigan (world-class views) is unparalleled. The hotel has an authentic "Old World" charm, and large, gracious rooms that reflect the grand architecture of the 1920s. But to some extent I think the hotel is resting on its laurels. This was our experience when we recently stayed in two rooms for three nights with our teenage children: We arrived at 6:30 on a Friday night. The clerk at the front desk could not have been less happy to see us. In fact, one of our rooms was still not ready. He offered by way of apology that the previous guests checked out late and had not bothered to notify them. Our son was battling strep throat at the time, and desperate to get to bed. We settled him into our room. Almost one hour later he received the call that his room was ready. Maybe I expect too much, but I'd like to think that if I were running a hotel I would have sent along a fruit basket or chicken soup or something by way of apology. It's 6:30 and our room isn't ready? Could you have put us in another room, perhaps? Or offered an upgrade? it's possible the hotel was booked, but it was the weekend, not yet summer holiday, and the hotel truly did not seem busy. Next, our room: It is spacious, with a breathtaking view of Lake Michigan. But take your eyes off the lake and the view quickly deteriorates. This room (#844, I think) seems like the room that time forgot--or at least the decorators overlooked. There are no comfy chairs for sitting and admiring the view. There is one straight-backed chair, and one other Aeron type chair at the desk. Neither is conducive to lounging in one's robe enjoying coffee and a newspaper--which may be why they don't provide either amenity. I called housekeeping to ask to have two robes brought up, but nobody answered the phone. When I called the next day, they were gracious and brought them up quickly. The bed is large and comfy, but the linens are sparse. There are white pillowcases and a white duvet cover, with a simple coverlet folded at the bottom of the bed. it feels unfinished--like a woman dressed in lingerie waiting to put on her party dress. But there is no party dress--no bedspread or pillow shams or ridiculous fringed and lace-trimmed boudoir pillows that my husband hurls in exasperation but that make me feel like a princess. The lack of linens feels like a shortcut with a view to easing the housekeeping burden. Once in bed, it's impossible to overlook the tangle of cords and wires ballooning out underneath the desk. The view is not dissimilar from what I see in my basement at home. The big difference, however, is that I don't pay $400/night for the privilege. Do I expect too much from my hotel rooms? Maybe. When I book what I expect to be a luxury hotel, I want luxury. I want a suspension of reality. I didn't get that at the Drake. And while I think I would stay there again, I'd be very specific when booking about the type of room I wanted. To end on a positive note, here were what I considered nice touches: --Gratis bottles of water in the room each day --Free hearty breakfast and all-day snacks and drinks available in the executive lounge overlooking Lake Michigan --Unbeatable location, with all of Chicago at one's doorstep

Reviews.Title: “Friendly welcome, great service.”
Reviews.Author: Tracey996
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a prime location north of the river on the corner of N Michigan Avenue (Magnificent Mile) and E Walton Place. So it's ideal for shopping - Water Tower Place, Macy's, Bloomingdales etc as well as Tiffany's, Louis Vitton, Gucci and all the other designer shops. It also has views over looking the Lake (our room had such a view). you can walk along the beach front easily from here too. Within 2 miles of the hotel you will find all the main attractions for sight seeing - Millenium Park, Navy Pier, Museums and arts and cultural centres. The staff here were excellent, giving advice and information on the best places to go. They were also very welcoming and made us feel relaxed as soon as we arrived - important after a long day travelling. The rooms are large and spacious with huge king size beds and fully equiped with mini bar, tv, haidryer, iron, safe etc and a small walk in wardrobe with plenty of hanging space.

Reviews.Title: “The Drake was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: coolwaves
Reviews.Content: We booked the Drake for 3 nights through priceline for $90. It was a real deal. The location is excellent, right at the north end of Michigan Ave. Shopping , beach , restaurants, public transports are all within one or two blocks. The hotel has been renovated and all the public spaces look nice and clean. Rooms are good sized and the beds are very comfortable. Downside is you have to pay for internet. However, you can get free wifi downstairs in the coffee shop. It is not widely advertised though. I had gelato and cofee there. Prices are not too bad. The fitness center is free, but parking is $49 per night , so drop the car. All in all, we would definitely come back to Chicago and I wouldn't mind staying at the Drake again.

Reviews.Title: “Top class , No complaints”
Reviews.Author: flanmanDublin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the st. patricks day parade in march. It was a five night stay and from the check in to check out everything was perfect. Great value too. We particularly like the very classy enterance which makes you feel important just walking through the doors.

Reviews.Title: “The Drake is a fantastic property with great service and ideal location”
Reviews.Author: JRBPT
Reviews.Content: The Drake hotel is wonderful. We have a puppy and wanted to travel with her for the first time and she was welcomed at the Drake. The service was great and the hotel is in a perfect location near Michigan Avenue and the lake front. We'll come back to this property.

Reviews.Title: “A delight! Elegant but relaxed. Friendly plus awesome service.”
Reviews.Author: wandw
Reviews.Content: The Drake is the real deal. A lovely old style hotel, well upgraded and maintained with a wonderful staff, lovely public spaces and rooms, good food. Excellent location with wonderful restaurants within easy walking distance. Ditto for shopping - right on the Magnificant Mile. Oak Street Beach is adjacent where you can walk for miles along Lake Michigan. We can't imagine ever staying anywhere else in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but wouldn't necessarily stay there again”
Reviews.Author: jonathanhsinger
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Drake for a couple of nights. The room was large, the bed comfortable. But the furnishings in the room were somewhat older, and the air conditioning vent was placed in a position above the bed so that it was either too warm or too cold in the room. That said, I did enjoy my stay -- particularly the tea, which is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: Logofffarms
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful with a real sense of Chicago history. The rooms were nicely appointed and clean (we stayed on an Executive Floor), although the lack of WiFi in the room was a little surprising. The rooms were quiet (despite the ice machine right outside our door), and the bed was extremely comfortable. Lots of towels and lovely bathrobes provided, and a well stocked mini-bar. Our stay included breakfast and found the both the buffett and menu items to be wonderful, hot and fresh, with lots of variety. We also enjoyed nightcaps in the hotel bar, were we found a great selection to choose from. The staff in both the hotel and restaurant were attentive, polite, and extremely helpful. However, could not end this review with a salute to Andrea at the Conceirge desk. She went above and beyond the call of duty and made our first trip to Chicago a reason to come back for a second.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: cathyhub
Reviews.Content: The Drake is past its prime. It has an opulent lobby, nice linens, good sized rooms and attentive front staff and THAT'S IT. Our visit was marred from the moment we arrived with an exaggeration of the view ("partial lake view" which turns out means "cement wall"), filthy dishes (glasses and coffee cups), inadequate toiletries, incomplete information about dining, exorbitant fees for everything imaginable, tattered furniture (literally threads hanging off upholstery) an irritating phone answering system, and too many housekeeping staff who, while very apologetic and anxious to please after screw-ups, didn't seem to have the initiative or education to fix things ahead of time. In addition, while the rooms were quiet the doors were not and we were constantly woken up by people coming and going across the short hall from us (we were in a corner room where doors faced each other). Add to that no pool and no spa and the fact that the hotel is too far north of the "loop" and museum action, and we won't be returning again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend @ The Drake, but...”
Reviews.Author: Michelyn
Reviews.Content: Spent a long weekend visiting Chicago for the St Pattys day celebrations. We got 2 rooms at the Drake hotel via priceline for $90/night. Prior to arrival we had spoke to the hotel and requested King beds (1 couple per room) and all was well. En route to Chicago we called to confirm our reservation to find out that we did indeed have 2 rooms, but 1 room only had 1 single bed and the other room had 2 single beds! Not a very romantic weekend! After numerous phone calls to the hotel and to priceline we were pleasantly surprised when we checked in to have 1 room with a queen bed and the other with a double bed. Still not Kings but for the price, great! The hotel itself is older, but in a glamorous way. Grand chandaliers and large, fancy floral arrangements but with well appointed rooms. Flat screens, granite tops an super comfy beds. We did have drinks at the hotel piano bar - good service, high prices. The location is right off the magnificent mile and very close to all the other restaurant/tourist attractions. Parking is expensive everywhere - the hotel valet is $45/night but that is the same in any major city. all in all a great hotel in a great location - just be weary sometimes of third party booking.

Reviews.Title: “good value, except for terrible bathroom”
Reviews.Author: mariemel
Reviews.Content: We stayed with friends for Thanksgiving, hotel staff were really nice and helpful about directions and food locations around, the rooms were clean, huge beds. Continental breakfast was ok, juice, coffee, bananas and some muffins. Just enough not to feel hungry, nothing extra. But second day we came like half an hour before breakfast was over, and literally there was nothing there, only 3 juices left, so when we asked if they gonna put up smth for us, they were like no, that there is nothing left for today. So we were left without breakfast, so wake up early if u want to get anything, beside the sitting area is limited, there is nowhere to eat if 2-3 sitting couches r full, plus u r kinda sitting right next to the entrance. Their bathroom floor was very weird, like the shower and the general floor were on the same level, so when u took shower, water would be all over the bathroom, which was terrible, bcs u had to manually push the water back after shower with towels, bcs bathroom was impossible to walk in. Beside the morning we were moving out, the toilet water came out when we flushed it, and started to fill up very quickly, and next second toilet water was all over the place, called the reception, and they sent the plumber pretty quickly. Internet was very very very slow, sometimes didn't even connect. Overall ok hotel for the money u pay, and location is all right, if ur ready to walk 30 min to Millenium Park area.

Reviews.Title: “number 1”
Reviews.Author: yatsey
Reviews.Content: The drake hotel has two great things going for it, the history and its location. The place oozes class (which off course you pay for). the location at the top of magnificent mile means its near to all the shops and surrounded by bars and restaurants. Its also by the beach so easy to go for a pleasant stroll when the weather permits. if your in chiacgo on business then its a little away from the offices but i mean literally 1-2km away so a $10 taxi ride (of which there is a long line of cars waiting outside the hotel). I would certainly go back, especially if the purpose of your trip was leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Spundiferous
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Drake to celebrate our anniversary and we were both quite disappointed. Two of the elevators were out of service and the one we did ride in got stuck. Our room was very musty and not updated. it looked very shabby. The only thing that saved it was the view. Visit the Drake for its historical significance but stay somewhere else becuase the rooms are not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Multiple billing problems.”
Reviews.Author: danPtEdward
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel in December. There was multiple billing problems which required multiple phone calls and e-mails. The problems were finally corrected for my March credit card statement. I called and e-mailed the hotel manager multiple times but there was never a response.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel nice stay”
Reviews.Author: auswanderer
Reviews.Content: Had friendly staff although I am a low maintenance hotel guest my brother and I enjoyed our stay at The Drake, location was pretty good room was nice view was of an adjacent building from our room but I'm sure there are rooms with a nice view. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Double billed, clogged tub but nice”
Reviews.Author: heythere2
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really beautiful. They do a great job of preserving the history there. However, for as much as I paid to stay there, I should not have been double billed and the tub should not have been clogged up with hair.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: tjh780
Reviews.Content: We booked (the day before we left) the $85 prepaid internet special at the Drake. When we arrived we were upgraded to a deluxe lakeview king room. We had a huge corner room on the northside of the hotel facing the lake. Had afternoon tea in the lobby. It was a wonderful stay. Check their internet booking rates. Why would you stay anyehere else? Also the Art Institute of Chicago has free admission during February!

Reviews.Title: “Simple things were hard to do...”
Reviews.Author: outdoorfungirl
Reviews.Content: It is a very grand place and beautiful but it also was very challenging at times to do simple things. Parking is miserable and the garage guys only take cash and it has to be under a $50....well try to find an atm machine... You couldn't just find something to drink after a long trip to the city...even a simple bottle of water or soda was going to cost you big $. It was also well below zero degrees so trying to get our car out of the parking garage and drive to a place was out of the question it already took way too long to get parked. Walking in that weather was not going to happen either. We were able to check in super early which was the best part of the stay. Our room had a beautiful view of the bay but needed quite a bit of maintenance. We also didn't have enough hot water for showers....

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest largest suites in a simply gorgeous and grant hotel.”
Reviews.Author: julie h
Reviews.Content: My family recently stayed at the Drake and frequently make Chicago trips). We stayed in room 511 (a family suite) and I swear it must have been at least 800 square feet! It was absolutely gorgeous! It was a corner looking out on Michigan Ave. My husband and our 2 kids (ages 8 and 14) stayed two nights in January. This hotel is a gem. It is magnificent and did not look the least bit shabby. It's old, certainly, but it is grand and old in a good way, nice architecture, crown molding, etc. We ordered from GrubHub Thai food and ate it in the room - what fun! We also received full breakfast with the suite. We had a king bed and a sofa bed, but they also brought an extra nice large rollaway for one of the kids as well as 2 extra feather duvets. I was a bit worried after having read some reviews nut was so pleasantly surprised by everything. The TV is free on regular channels and there are many many channels, but the internet is $12.95 and is only available wired, which is fairly common and was not a disappointment to me - just info for you. The breakfast buffet was fantastic! If you are accustomed to Ponderosa then go somewhere else. This is a gourmet buffet with smoked salmon and capers! Of course they do have the standard scrambled eggs and bacon also, as well as muffins, pastries, fruits, cheeses, yoghurts, cold cuts, cereals, pancakes, Nutella, peanut butter, juices and etc. Loved it! The staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome. Anything we needed we were greeted with a can-do attitude. I even went off and accidentally left my train tickets in the room ($160!) after having checked out and when I called, Cynthia from housekeeping went and found them for me! I am surprised anyone even made the effort at such a large hotel. Believe me this is not the first time I have left something at a hotel but it is the first time the staff at a hotel cared to find my item. I won't soon forget this hospitality. We have recently stayed at the Sofitel, Dana Spa, Monaco, Rafaello (lost PJs there), all in Chicago, and now I feel my loyalty should be at the Drake and when possible we will stay there from now on. THANK YOU AGAIN CYNTHIA!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “great location, but there are better hotels in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: Even A
Reviews.Content: We had booked an executive room to have a nice view, access to an executive lounge with continental breakfast and free drinks/snacks through the day. When we came we were upgraded to a junior suite. That was nice, but the room was old and standard. The we went up the the executive lounge, and to our surprise it was closed for renovation! Later we went to the front desk, and they gave us vouchers for breakfast in the restaurant... well...the voucher had a value of 22$, and it was impossible to have breakfast for that amount...a standard breakfast with orange juice and coffee was about 30...we tried to argue that we shouldn't pay extra for something that were supposed to be included....but no....all together a nice stay, but we will find another hotel next time...

Reviews.Title: “I'm just commenting on the virtual tour and video tour”
Reviews.Author: carla054
Reviews.Content: i just have to say that i was very impressed with their virtual online tour. i have never seen one so detailed. it was a real treat. it walks you through as if you are an actual guest. i have actually gone inside the hotel once before and i remember feeling like i was rich. from what i've been told, luxury hotels at this time were being built in a way so that anyone entering its doors would feel like a millionaire. They achieved this with grand lobbies, balconies, and an all live in accessible layout. meaning, you could basically live within the hotel area with a restaurant, tea room, ballroom, theatre, stores, etc. i can say that while the virtual tour was impressive, there is nothing that can top the actual feeling you get when you really walk up into the lobby. that you have to do for yourself! i also was impressed with the video tour which had clips featuring the hotel. i loved hearing about the cod restaurant and how marilyn monroe and joe domaggio carved their initials into the wooden table. also how princess diana stayed there! i even went into the president suite where she stayed (via virtual tour of course!). i liked hearing about when it opened and the elegant ghost story of the gold cost suite. and the feature showing the clips from movies that have been filmed there. totally awesome. the only complaint i have is that some of the rooms look like they could use a little more decorating. some have too much of that executive look and i'd also like to see more darker richer colors like in the gold coast suite i liked the dark blue with the bedding. but in the living room it looked too light and almost faded from age. though i think they should keep some of the rooms the way they were. especially the presidential. i think they've left it the way it was since princess diana was there...and that's exactly what they should do.

Reviews.Title: “My best hotel experience yet!”
Reviews.Author: Moos3h
Reviews.Content: I will find it hard not to gush too much in this review! We stayed at the Drake Hotel from the 31st Dec to 4th January and were so greatful of the luxury of the hotel when the cold Chicago wind was blowing. The staff were all friendly, helpful and genuine without being in any way smarmy or aloof - a refreshing change from many european hotels, I can tell you! The room was excellent, a good size with a lovely bathroom (lovely bath and good shower), fully stocked (expensive) minbar and HUGE TV. The bed and bedding were of VERY high quality and although I found the room rather hot at night, this could be easily fixed with the air con or opening the window a fraction. Check in and Check out were both dealt with expertly, and the standard of cleaning was also excellent. Lack of free WiFi would be my only real complaint. I would not hesitate to stay at the Drake again and will recommend it to everyone I know who is considering visiting the wonderful city of Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: Virginia2002
Reviews.Content: My husband & I were here for 5 nights mid December while he attended a conference. My husband had a discounted rate due to the conference& we both felt it was a great deal. We received a very nice king room facing north towards Lake Shore Dr. Pluses were a comfy bed, a scale in the bathroom, close to shopping and a bus stop, lots of restaurants within walking distance, and good info from the concierge on which bus to take ( road the bus to the Field Museum). One nice touch - some of the elevators had upholstered benches in them. My husband had the buffett breakfast one morning and said there were few choices. So it was not worth the over $20 charge & others that attended the conference agreed. Instead we found a Corner Bakery and a Pancake House close by (2-3 blocks away) that we walked to. For our long stay, we only received 1 bar of soap for bathing which was just about gone our last morning. I believe in conserving but we could have used another bar. Our room had a makeup mirror but it was placed very very high on the wall. Way too high for me even on my tiptoes & too high for my 6 ft. husband. With all this said, I would stay there again. By the way, I walked to the Oriental Theatre and bought a ticket at the box office for "The Adams Family" with Nathan Lane & Bebe Neuwirth. Also had some great meals at the Signature Room on the 95th Floor of the John Hancock room and the Grand Luxe Cafe. Light dinners at Foodlife and the Soup Box.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it used to be”
Reviews.Author: chelsea1977
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my patner who is from chicago and knows what the drake used to be. I have stayed at numerous 5 star hotels and this one was disappointing. You can tell they are cutting back, there was no room turn down service, we had to move rooms after the first night as our room was noisy, Room service took way too long, was overpriced and there was nothing on the plate, it was more like a starter than a main course. As a Hilton diamond card holder, we went to the lounge to find it only opened at certain times and you had to pay for your drinks, this is not the case in europe.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Traveling CA
Reviews.Content: You can tell they are cutting back. I know times are hard but when you charge $300 you expect fast service. Room service took way too long and I was late for my meeting.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for a better hotel experience!”
Reviews.Author: Londe98
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the Drake from 11/18-11/22. We came to see the Oprah show, and we also spent the weekend shopping. We had such a great experience. The hotel staff was super friendly, especially Tom Marshall at checkin. We were upgraded for free from a room with a king size bed to a room with 2 bathrooms and 2 oversized queen beds. The staff went out of their way to make sure we had a great visit. The hotel was clean and very nice, and quiet considering the Light's festival was that weekend. The location of the hotel was perfect...ideal for shopping and enjoying the Mag. Mile. I highly recommend the Drake.

Reviews.Title: “Great overnight stay !”
Reviews.Author: cdr2120
Reviews.Content: Great overnight stay at The Drake on 11/7. I reserved the room at a great price via Priceline. I sent the manager an email requested a renovated room and he made it happen! I was pleased with the follow through, especially since we were paying a lower rate. Yes, the rooms are a bit dated but that is by design. If you are looking for sleek and modern, stay at W. Parking was a bit steep at $49 but that includes in & out, which we utilized to pack up at the end of the stay utnil we were done shopping. Overall, great stay and I would recommend to anyone looking for a night away.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: windycitytraveler51
Reviews.Content: we spent 4 nights at the Drake and enjoyed a superb experience. The room was large and included a mini fridge. the bed was the most comfortable one I have ever slept in, simply luxurious.Check-in and check-out was quick, and the hotel staff were most courteous. I will definetly stay there again when I visit Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Old and Tired”
Reviews.Author: sushel
Reviews.Content: I've always wanted to stay at this hotel due to the reputation and location. We were celebrating our 20th anniversary and I booked the room online. We had reservations at a fancy Italian restaurant right across the street and I thought everything would be perfect. When we checked in I realized I should have splurged on a suite and asked if I could upgrade. The agent (as if reading from a script) said since I booked online she could not do that. I explained that it was our 20th anniversary and my wife was looking forward to a special weekend. She barely looked up and handed me a key to a room that had not been touched for at least 25 years! The bathroom had chipped tile and dull marble. I was shocked at the state of the place. We spent as little time as possible in the room and tried to make the best of it. For $300.00 I've stayed at nicer and more plush Hiltons or Marriotts. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone! The doorman was very nice however.

Reviews.Title: “Top Ratings Across the Board for this Very Top Hotel - THE BEST!”
Reviews.Author: MMG-NYC
Reviews.Content: My friends and I were elated when we got tickets to the Oprah show, but our stay at The Drake was the icing on the cake. The location couldn't be better -- steps from Chicago's historic Water Tower, the John Hancock building, and all the fabulous shops and restaurants of the Magnificent Mile. The convenience factor was a saving grace for us as we were able to walk everywhere, minimizing cab fares, and could easily stop at the hotel to drop off shopping bags or relax between sites. Our two bathroom, double queen room was perfect for the four of us. We especially appreciated the extra bathroom when we had to get up early and all prep at once for Oprah. I would imagine that the same room configuration would be perfect for a family -- the room was so spacious that it even had a living room area and separate office nook! Every corner of the hotel exudes elegance, from the spectacular floral arrangement in the lobby to the recently renovated hallways and comfortable, upscale rooms. The staff was welcoming, helpful, and polite. The saltwater taffys on our pillows were a nice touch. If you want to make the most of your trip to Chicago, stay at The Drake. It truly offers the best of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Good if you like twin beds”
Reviews.Author: Isabellelivia
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful. We were impressed until we got to the room and found out that the two beds we had requested were TWIN beds. I did not know any hotels had twin beds anymore. We should of been told that on the phone . We had three people in our party so we went down to desk and talked to "Lorenzo" but he would not help us at all.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous Stay at The Drake”
Reviews.Author: delyn3798
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I recently stayed at The Drake Hotel during a visit to run in the Chicago Marathon. I had booked the room using Priceline, and was thrilled when The Drake Hotel popped up as our hotel. However, after reading some of the reviews on tripadvisor, I became a bit worried that we might end up in a small room needing renovation. I emailed the manager, Tom Thomas, to request the best possible room during our stay. Within a few hours, I received an email back from the Executive Assistant welcoming us in advance and assuring me that we would enjoy our stay. I kept my fingers crossed. We arrived a bit early for our stay (11:30a) and inquired about check-in, but the current guest had not checked out yet. We left our bags and went out for a bit. I called back at 1:30p, and the clerk (who politely remembered me) said our room was now ready. Upon entering the hotel, you can truly feel the emphasis they put on luxury. The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful, from the front desk clerks, to the concierge to the bell man. Everyone had a smile on their face and friendly things to say. The enormous flower display in the lobby fills the room with a lovely fragrance. When we checked in to our room, I could not have been more pleased! It was an enormous room, with two large beds and best of all two bathrooms. Perfect for three women! The beds were incredibly comfortable, with plenty of soft pillows and soft sheets. There was a large sitting area, nice TV, and even two large windows with a view. Everything was exceptionally clean and to a very high standard. If you are considering The Drake Hotel, I would suggest you book the hotel with confidence, and simply email the manager to ensure your room meets your expectations. We were thrilled with our stay and will definitely consider The Drake Hotel for future visits to downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: Bstone79
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for several nights. Granted we didn't spend too much time in the hotel, it was a great experience. I reccomend upgrading to the Executive Floors if you can.

Reviews.Title: “exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: akm107
Reviews.Content: we live in Chicago, but wanted a weekend to just "getaway", and ive always wanted to stay at The Drake, so he called and booked a weekend there a week before we went. We checked in around 6pm that friday (after work, of course!) to find that we were upgraded from our junior suite to an executive suite! The hotel is a historic hotel, a classic with old-skool furnishings. It truly is a beautiful site to see! (for those looking to stay at a *modern* hotel, this is NOT the place for you, unless you can appreciate what some have called "grandma furnishings" in other reviews...). The elevators have little couches in them (which gave me a good laugh) and i forced us to sit down on them every time we were in the elevator alone (no man in his right mind would do this publicly :) ). Each design in the hallway all the way down to the room was so detail oriented, you can tell the craftsmanship was of great quality. The hallways were nice and wide, no need to struggle getting down as you pass others on the way to the room. The room was FANTASTIC! It was a corner room with a lakeview. The parlor was huge with a couch, armoire (tv inside), large desk, and a table with 4 chairs. Then in the next room was the bedroom which had a king size bed that was SOFT and lovely, full with at least 6 pillows. Next room was the bathroom which had marble stairs leading up to a jacuzzi tub that could probably fit 4 people in it, a seperate standing shower and a double vanity. It was def a spacious, romantic room and we were pleased. Lots of towels available for use too, big towels, not the small ones that barely get around your body! The only thing I noticed was that the TVs were very outdated (had to at least be from early 90s), as well as the telephones... however, I can maybe see why as it keeps the "old character" of the hotel intact. I can appreciate that kind of stuff, esp when its creating the old-Chicago feel! Location wise, the Drake really is centrally located within the Mag Mile. Its one block north of the Hancock Tower and Water Tower Place, with ample shopping, a stone's throw from the beach, and a good walk to Navy Pier if you'd really like. We ate at the Drake Brothers Restaurant in the Drake every morning, as it was part of our package. Without the package, a breakfast buffet for 2 would cost $52, just to serve as an fyi. Some may say over priced, but why would you expect anything less from a 4-5 star hotel??? The food was delicious with a wide variety to choose from. Concierge service in the lobby was nice, very informative (to the people in front of us, at least) and was able to provide me with a bandaid when I asked for it - thanks Andrea! I loved this hotel and would suggest it to anyone coming in for a visit that wouldnt mind splurging on a nice hotel. :)

Reviews.Title: “good time at the drake”
Reviews.Author: Corry2006
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our trip to chicago/stay at the drake. this was our first trip to chicago. we agree with most of the previous hotel reviews. a beautiful hotel with an incredible history. the lobby and upper restaurant/bar are amazing and elegant. the food and service was great. we had one of our best meals at the Coq d'or bar downstairs. we stopped for there for a drink almost everynight and they had live music every evening. that was wonderful. everyone that worked at the hotel was helpful and friendly. it is also a good location. right across the street from bloomingdales. macy's is 2 blocks down the street and the john hancock building is next door. we only encountered two problems our entire stay. 1. we prepaid for our hotel room ($247 usd for an executive suite room-10th floor) and it wasn't ready when we arrived at 8 pm. they said it wasn't cleaned yet, and then a few minutes later they said they was a maintenance problem. so they put us on another floor in a smaller room (with a lake view). which I felt was a down grade from what we had initially paid for. the next morning we went to complain and they did immediately, without hesitation put us in the room we had previously requested/paid for. the executive room was very large with a couch/sitting area, king bed, desk and chair and 2 closets. we were very happy with the room. the private lounge was also very nice. it had a lake view...with a cold breakfast buffet included with the price. I guess the main point I want to make is that PREPAID / PRESELECTED ROOMS DOESN'T GUARANTEE you anything. I was under the impression that the room we had prepaid for would be held and ready for us upon check-in...not the next day. 2. my other problem is that my hotel room card was deactived the morning we were leaving. I left our room around 9 am and I couldn't get back into our room at 10 am. check-out isn't until noon. luckly my husband was there to let me in. what if I was alone and stepped out for a second in my PJ's...how embarrassing that could of been! overall, we enjoyed our stay. the rooms were very clean and the bed was extremely comfortable. if you appreciate history and elegance this is a great hotel. a must see. p.s. we give it a 4* instead of 5* due to the room issues we had.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of incredible history but overrated!”
Reviews.Author: jbooger
Reviews.Content: This hotel has incredible history and beautiful architecture but once you've seen all the magnificant common rooms (lobby, ballroom, Palm Court, old style elevators) it isn't any different than any other overpriced, 4 star historical hotel. Our friends were getting married in the ballroom so we thought that we would take this opportunity to stay at The Drake since I'm pregnant and it would be an easy escape for me to my room in the wee hours. Check in was at 3:00 and we were there on time as the wedding trolley was leaving at 5:30 and we needed time to get ready. At check in we were offered a deluxe upgrade on our king room but the hitch was that it wouldn't be ready for over an hour. Talk about dangling the carrot and yanking it away! We couldn't wait an hour and considering check in wasn't until 3:00 I can't imagine why the room wasn't ready. We settled for our existing king reservation (at $250) and found the room to be fine but of course our view was of the air conditioning units and we were next door to the Fitness area. So much for wedding party group booking bonus! I can't imagine how much money our friends spent for their wedding at The Drake but I'm sure they would have been mortified to hear about the rooms that their guests were given especially since they were "promised" that everyone under the group booking would be nicely taken care of. Pro's - decor was decent, slightly dated but clean. room was decent size, noise between rooms/floors was negligible. Bathroom was ok in size but only suitable for one person at a time. Con's - heating system was horribly loud, had to turn it off at night to sleep, no exhaust fan in bathroom, wireless access was not free, bottled water was $7.00 for a small bottle, split of wine was over $25, breakfast was over $25 per person with another 20% markup for room service. There was coffee in the room but I wasn't sure if it was free and the room service menu said it was $15 so we popped over to Starbucks instead. Parking was ok at $39 a night if you use the public parking lot two doors down - you can even charge it to your room tab. We ended arriving a day early and didn't have a room booked. On Hotwire we found a 3 star hotel for $63 a night in the magnificant mile area. We weren't getting in until 11:00 p.m. so we weren't that picky. The hotel ended up being the Holiday Inn Express. Of course for $63 our room overlooked the air conditioning units here as well but we had a very comfortable king bed, huge plasma tv, wonderfully decorated room, free breakfast, free wireless and a great location. The room was super small - basically just enough room for the king bed and a really small bathroom but for the money it was so much more worth it than The Drake. The building was beautiful, location was great, personnel were very friendly, self parking was around the corner. Ok, there's no ballroom, no Palm Court and Queen Elizabeth didn't stay here but does that really matter??? Save your money, skip The Drake, walk through it if you want to check it out, but there are plenty of beautiful hotels in the magnificant mile area for alot less money!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, NO HEAT, NO HOT WATER”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTravelerNYC
Reviews.Content: The Drake greatly disappointed me: â€¢ Valet lost my car and made me late to work â€¢ The rooms don't have heat until the temperature is below 50 in your room â€¢ The hot water is intermittent; no hot water often during a shower â€¢ Management not interested in their problems â€¢ Trash in the hall ways â€¢ No wireless, only ethernet â€¢ TV system is very dated, doesn't work well

Reviews.Title: “Had a fabulous price - that made it a fantastic vacation”
Reviews.Author: codieshousePA
Reviews.Content: We had the most incredible price and the front desk seemed a bit put out by the low price that we were paying. However they were the only ones who didn't seem overly friendly. The wait staff in the restaurant, the staff at the lounge and the bellmen were wonderful. Our room didn't have a view of the lake, but it was a very nice room and it almost seemed like suite with the entry, sitting area and bedroom lay-out. We had family in the area who came to have dinner with us and when we took their teen daughters up to see the room, the 16 year-old said it was like walking through Titanic. And that does seem like an accurate description of the old-money feel in the decor. We were going to go on-line at the business center but the price seemed ridiculous and we're Hilton gold. I thought we have had free use as this is part of the Hilton chain.

Reviews.Title: “Don't miss the scary butler!”
Reviews.Author: kentucky63
Reviews.Content: My kids got a complte hoot out of the scary butler who's outside the flower shop/gift store on the ground floor. (He's motion activated and will speak when you come in.) Be sure not to miss it!

Reviews.Title: “The Drake is like home”
Reviews.Author: chief1953
Reviews.Content: My wife & I have visited the Drake twice in 2 years for a mini-vacation. Since we rarely travel, I was reluctant to go to another hotel because we know the Drake (familiar territory). I have described it as a "middle" hotel, not too expensive, but not the cheapest either. i am amused by the complaints for different hotels and the mini-bar prices, etc. This is Chicago, everything is expensive. The liquor is in fact cheaper or about the same in the min-bar as in a regular bar (not the Drake bar). The rooms could stand upgrading, especially the carpets and the furniture. I feel a good portion of their income is from conventioneers, lots of those going on. The hotel is beautiful in the lobby, and the tea room service is great. They have a nice Espresso shop now, and a neat art gallery, and other shops. There is access to the beach right across the street, if you are so inclined. The concierge has never steered us wrong yet, and we used them a lot. We went out on my bday and he said just stroll over to Rush street and there are several places, which we did. Great time too, and very simple, one block away. I have read reviews about the maids rattling in the linen closet, but we stayed next to one (a closet) and it wasn't a problem. I also have read about problems with water pressure but ours was fine both trips.Our view wasn't anything special, but we didn't come for the view, and I feel we could have specified one, but the rate might have been more, not sure. We didn't eat in the restuarants but did have a burger in the bar. The guys out front always remember us when we need a cab, and are helpful. The bellhop took the time to point out features in the room for us (which we knew already) but it was nice. Finally, did everyone notice the Manager commenting on negative reviews on this site? I feel that is good follow-up. We will probably go back again next year, you can have a bad experience in any hotel. Our stays went very well.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jmdallas
Reviews.Content: We had a good experience at the Drake. We got a good deal on Priceline but still got a newly updated room with 2 beds as we wanted. The place is still old (doors, carpet) but all have character. The lobby is gorgeous. We did not eat/drink there but there was a beautiful bar. Our only really bad experience was the concierge service, they were not at all helpful or even pay attention to what you are asking. Expensive internet also. Tips: Take the river architecture tour, wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Where there's smoke...”
Reviews.Author: mgbryant00
Reviews.Content: For another $25, we splurged for the larger room when we checked in. We dropped our things and went to eat/shop. After a long walk and fighting the crowds on Michigan Ave., we returned to the room just wanting to nap. No kids for the weekend, so just pure quiet and personal freedom. Unfortunately, when we returned to the room, it stank of cigarette smoke. I pushed the call button for the front desk, no answer. I called again, impatient because of the exhaustion, no answer. The third time was answered after a number of rings. I explained to the individual that the room smelled like smoke and that it was pretty nauseating. She told me to hold while she transferred me to the front desk--I must have rolled to another department. After explaining the predicament again, the front desk asked what they could do. Not wanting to be a burden, I asked for air freshener. They said they would send someone up. About 15 minutes later, the smoke and the waiting was too much, so I called again and asked for another room. They didn't have anything available until possibly 4, so they suggested we wait 2 hours until a room opened up. We couldn't bear the room, so we sat in the lobby on "grandma's couch" for about 30 minutes before realizing we wouldn't find any comfort there. We walked out of the hotel and saw a Bentley out front. It occurred to me perhaps why we were seemingly being ignored by the hotel. We gave the desk a cell # before we left and actually believed they would call it. But after miserably propping our heads up on a bar until 4, we still hadn't heard from them. There didn't seem to be much interest in making things right. When we returned to the front desk, they apparently had a room available but had not called us (no surprise). It was smaller than the previous room (though must have still been worth the extra $25 since it was never refunded). We could hear people in the next room, but they weren't very loud, so it wasn't an issue. Primarily where the hotel erred was on the most basic elements--the things you take for granted. The things you would expect even from a Motel 6. The Homewood Suites we stayed at a few months before wasn't as fancy, but it was much more reliable.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a great city”
Reviews.Author: wtmarks
Reviews.Content: We could not have had a better time at the Drake. It is obvious that we were in one of the recently refurbished rooms because it was perfect in every way. The room looked out onto Lake Shore Drive and the lake. An unexpected bonus was being able to watch the professional volleyball tournament being played on the beach. We have stayed at the Drake several times in the past and have always gotten great service. This stay was no different. From the bellman to the concierge to the doorman to the front desk staff to the waiters in the restaurants, the service could not have been better. The Coq d'Or is one of my favorite bars in the world. The decor is very romantic and the bartenders are very old school and lots of fun to talk to. We also had excellent breakfasts in the Drake Brothers Restaurant and a memorable dinner in the Cape Cod Room. The bed was extremely comfortable and the shower was perfect. The bathroom was not large, but it was very well maintained. We also loved the fitness center. It was complete with cardio, weights, etc. The common areas (lobby and tea salon) are very European and some of the most beautiful in Chicago. We have previously stayed here during the Christmas season and they had a huge Christmas tree and trains running through the lobby - incredible. We are already planning a return trip next August.

Reviews.Title: “A grand, opulent hotel from the 1920s that still struts its stuff well!”
Reviews.Author: wicozani
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed here for two nights as the base for our first real vacation in some time. I booked our room on Priceline.com ($129), and we were given a nicely renovated room on the 7th floor (703), albeit with a fire escape/city view down to N. Michigan Ave. below. The room itself, however, was quite large and luxurious, with a wonderful bed and bedding, luxury toiletries in the bath, and very nice decor. However, the real attraction here is the hotel's public spaces, from the well-attended curbside reception area to the opulent lobby and Palm Court mixed use up a half-flight from the lobby. There are many interesting nooks and crannies in this hotel, and a very nice shopping promenade within. High Tea is served each afternoon in the Palm Court, which was delightful, and there is live music and dancing here in the evenings. A bonus, they were serving 2000 Dom Perignon by the glass in the Palm Court. Where have you ever seen this before? This is our wedding year, and we were surprised when we were presented with a complimentary chocolate torte dessert and half refill of the Dom when the staff heard this! We were made to feel quite special by all the staff, which is not at all the case in many mid-tier chain hotels. Finally, we had an excellent breakfast in the Drake's own restaurant, opulent and fairly priced. We did not have any of the ancillary charges that seem the basis for many of the preceding less-than-stellar reviews. Overall, we were simply delighted and hope to return soon to this ideally-located grand old hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fab Lake View”
Reviews.Author: worldtravellerplus77
Reviews.Content: This place does not dissapoint, upgraded to a room with a view of the lake - amazing... Seems like there has been some refurbishment since the last time I was here... All and all - great!

Reviews.Title: “HMM...if I had all the money in the world”
Reviews.Author: CBnFL
Reviews.Content: The Drake is a elegant hotel that you better bring your money too. The room we had was nice and elegant. We avoided the snacks and the mini bar since who can afford any of that. We never did eat at the Hotel since it was too price and not worth the value with so many restaurants near by. The Drake was nice to visit ONCE to say you have been but I find it hard to imagine a family staying there unless you are not concern about cost. In this economy who isn't. The location of the hotel is awesome. It is close to a lot of shopping and nightlife. Would I spend the money to go there again...NO. I will find a more modern hotel where I can lounge and enjoy a good breakfast and not just sleep there.

Reviews.Title: “Okay....”
Reviews.Author: kathyei23
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and very elegant. We booked a room on priceline and when we got there they had no standard rooms with two beds (even though we requested) so we had to upgrade. Not a great start but okay. The room was nice and spacious, two closets and two bathrooms and two beds (couch, table, etc). The location was pretty good being at the end of the Magnificent mile. We were two short blocks from Rush street (great dining) and close to State for Shopping. We also could walk down to the river in approximately 15 minutes. The bar/lounge was extremely over priced and the atmospher was that of a cheesy cruise ship lounge. We did not spend any time there. (a tang. tonic was 18.50)!! I probably would not stay here again because you could just as easly stay in a holiday inn express with a better location and a good breakfast included. You can get more bang for your buck elsewhere. Not a disappointment (exept that they didn't have a pool) but not a great review either. I would recommend staying somewhere in the loop, it's still really nice but a little bit more centralized.
